text:
沒有溫室效應，地球會結冰，因此它本來就存在，不是人類害的；不過工業革命後，人類破壞了它的平衡，讓溫室效應太超過了。
免疫學發展史上真的有這件滿諷刺的事：在肥皂被發明、人們居住環境大幅改善之後，自體免疫疾病的病例反而增加了，還有死於「原本極為普通且弱小的細菌感染」的人也增加了，因為免疫系統的後天免疫無法得到訓練。
author: Micky Yang
text_en:
Without the greenhouse effect, the earth would freeze, so it exists in the first place and is not harmful to humans; but after the industrial revolution, humans destroyed its balance and made the greenhouse effect too much.
There is really this ironic thing in the history of immunology: after soap was invented and people's living environment was greatly improved, the number of autoimmune diseases increased, and there were deaths from "originally very common and weak bacterial infections." The number of people has also increased because the acquired immunity of the immune system cannot be trained.

text: 我以前只知道水溶液當中的廷德耳效應，原來溫室氣體的發現跟他有關，長知識了！有貓就給讚！喵！防止溫室效應就是拯救全世界的咪咪！最近的影片觀看數真的非常少，以前可以到達數萬觀看，可以考慮多用一些關鍵字，或者用廣告試試看效果。
author: binladan911
text_en: I only knew about the Tyndall effect in aqueous solutions before. It turns out that the discovery of greenhouse gases is related to him, so I have gained a lot of knowledge! Like if there is a cat! Meow! Preventing the greenhouse effect is saving the world's Mimi! The number of recent videos is really very small. It used to reach tens of thousands of views. You can consider using more keywords or try using ads to see the effect.

text:
第一、實驗帶完還要講解課本內容、帶練習題、習作及學習單以及檢討作業跟檢討考卷，請問您這章節打算花幾節課做完？
第二、您這班級有沒有篩選過？一個常態分班的班級入實驗室有這麼聽話嗎？不用花時間管秩序？不用花時間重複說第二遍第三遍？叫他們寫學習單他們就會寫？不會有人擺爛跟別人玩？當沒有攝影機或是旁邊老師觀摩時，學生配合度也是如此高？
第三、雖然我沒教過三多國中，但我光是看片段內容我就能確定要馬三多國中素質不差，不然就是這個班級有特別挑過。否則普通班根本沒辦法如影片中的這麼順利帶學生探究和設計實驗。
第四、我認為作秀成分居多，就如同現在的公開觀課，永遠就只有那一堂課老師最會耍花招，其他時間就是瘋狂趕課。除非你的服務學校沒有榜單壓力，那你當然可以只把課本教完就好。尤其是中南部縣市的國中老師若沒有多教一點，以後招生就麻煩了喔~
author: YT W
text_en:
First, after the experiment, you will also need to explain the content of the textbook, with practice questions, exercises and study sheets, as well as review homework and review test papers. How many lessons do you plan to complete this chapter?
Second, has your class been screened? Is it so obedient for a normally divided class to enter the laboratory? Don't spend time managing order? No need to spend time repeating it the second time and the third time? Ask them to write a study sheet and they will do it? Wouldn't someone play badly with others? When there is no camera or when the teacher next to you is observing, the student's degree of cooperation is so high?
Third, although I have never taught Sanduo Middle School, I can be sure that the quality of Ma Sanduo Middle School is not bad just by looking at the content, otherwise this class has been specially selected. Otherwise, ordinary classes will not be able to lead students to explore and design experiments as smoothly as in the film.
Fourth, I think that the majority of show-making elements, just like the public observation of classes now, there will always be only the teacher who can play tricks the most, and the rest of the time is crazy rushing to class. Unless your service school has no list pressure, then of course you can just teach the textbooks. Especially if the junior high school teachers in the south-central counties and cities don’t teach more, enrolling students will be troublesome in the future~

text:
老師說的我懂，我在沒有使用過這套方法之前我也不相信。
過去四節課(不含第八節)，光是把課本內容搞定，把考卷、習題講解完都已經很趕了，怎麼可能還進實驗室。
所以我也曾經有段不相信「實驗」的教書時間，
那個時候 師生進教室真的越看越討厭。
.
過去曾經在新北一個城鄉文化落差相當大的學校授課
(EX：不知道什麼是「大英雄天團」，不知道誰是休傑克曼，
甚至連「電影」都沒看過的一群小孩，
喔，對了，
常常無故缺課時常態，
來了睡覺也是合乎認知) 
我不確定老師所面對的學生「素質」有多差，也不覺得「比較誰比較差」有任何的幫助啦!
#每班中補習的人數絕對少於1/2因為家中經濟狀況不允許
.

前幾年半信半疑的參與了LIS所舉辦的研習，將現場所碰到的問題提出來給大家討論。
嘗試將影片放進課堂中，不管是提起動機，還是讓學生醒來，或者做考試的獎賞 
(教室是沒有投影布幕的)
不瞞老師說，在當時利用實驗讓學生重新喜歡、期待上理化課，返家習題的練習從拒絕到主動完成。
我利用八年級下學期的課程做改變，
以實驗室為主，課堂練習為輔，完成很多學生覺得困難的莫耳數、酸鹼，甚至 力 的章節。
不管有沒有老師或者攝影機，學生忙著在找尋實驗中給他們的驚喜跟發現，不要說旁邊有沒有老師，甚至沒注意到已經打下課鐘聲。
誇張的是學生竟然會在其他背科課堂中主動拿起理化題目來寫。
#不管你信不信，我是相信學生的努力
.
至於成績，當年上下學期共六次的段考，撇開第一次段考不熟悉之外，剩下都在年級的前半。
我知道老師會說，那是剛好或者分配到好的班級。
試問，初來乍到且不熟悉的代理老師會給他素質比較好的班級?  還是將程度好的給學校具信任的正式老師?
順道，那3個班 今年準備要會考了，屆時再來跟老師分享這樣的實驗教學對於學生，尤其後半段的有多大的幫助。
.

最後，我相信LIS這套教材是幫助老師上課可以更順利。
不太可能全盤複製然後不需修改的直上任課班。
給學生一點契機，一點不一樣的感覺，我自己的經驗是學生真的從極被動，變成主動。
#一部影片不到10分鐘，如果還要呈現實驗室班經，我想2個小時都不夠呈現。
歡迎老師一起來共備討論，讓學生更好，讓學習更有效率。
author: Lin緯豈
text_en:
I understand what the teacher said, and I didn't believe it before I had used this method.
In the past four classes (not including the eighth section), I was too in a hurry to finish the textbook content and explain the examination papers and exercises. How could it be possible to return to the laboratory.
So I also had a period of teaching time when I didn’t believe in "experiments."
At that time, the more teachers and students entered the classroom, the more annoying they became.
.
In the past, I taught at a school in New Taipei where there was a considerable gap between urban and rural culture.
(EX: I don’t know what the "Big Hero Group" is, I don’t know who is Hugh Jackman,
A group of children who have never even seen a "movie",
Oh yes,
Normally when absent from class for no reason,
It's cognizant to come to sleep)
I'm not sure how bad the "quality" of the students the teacher is facing is, and I don't think "compared to who is worse" is any help!
#The number of tutoring students in each class is definitely less than 1/2 because the family's financial situation does not allow it
.

In the past few years, I participated in the seminars held by LIS dubiously, and brought up the problems encountered at the scene for everyone to discuss.
Try to put the film in the classroom, whether it is to raise motivation, wake up the student, or reward the exam
(There is no projection screen in the classroom)
According to the teacher, at that time, the experiment was used to make students like and look forward to taking physics and chemistry classes again, and the practice of returning home exercises went from rejection to active completion.
I use the next semester of the eighth grade to make changes,
Mainly in the laboratory, supplemented by classroom exercises, complete the chapters on molar number, acid-base, and even strength that many students find difficult.
Regardless of whether there is a teacher or a camera, the students are busy looking for surprises and discoveries for them in the experiment, not to mention whether there is a teacher next to them, or even noticing that the class bell has been struck.
The exaggeration is that students will take the initiative to pick up physical and chemical topics to write in other back courses.
# Believe it or not, I believe in the efforts of the students
.
As for the grades, there were a total of six semesters that year. Except for the unfamiliar first semester, the rest were all in the first half of the grade.
I know the teacher will say that it is just right or assigned to a good class.
May I ask, will a newcomer and unfamiliar agent teacher give him a better-quality class? Or will he give him a trustworthy official teacher with a good level?
By the way, those three classes are going to take the exam this year, and I will share with the teacher how much this kind of experimental teaching is helpful to the students, especially in the second half.
.

Finally, I believe that this set of teaching materials LIS is to help teachers go more smoothly in class.
It is impossible to copy it in full and then go straight to the class without modification.
Give students a little opportunity and feel a little different. My own experience is that students really change from being extremely passive to being active.
#A film is less than 10 minutes, if you want to show the laboratory class, I think 2 hours will not be enough to show.
Teachers are welcome to come and discuss together to make students better and make learning more efficient.

text:
@LIS情境科學教材  
謝謝您的回應，那請下次標題不要弄得這麼漂亮，因為使用挑過或特別訓練過的班級本來就有把實驗課上好的優勢。
下次請在一般的社區國中(就是非你們這種明星學校、或是學生單純素質高的學校)。你們可以選一些有名的流氓學校(為了不毀損校譽，請自行做功課。大家都是圈內人，隨便問問都知道)做一樣的課程，我想看看真實的實驗課。
很抱歉，因為我的服務學校學生素質低，所以我完全不相信你們這套方法可以用在其他中等或是中間偏下的學校。我還是覺得你們花很多心思在"表演"，一般學校根本做不到。
author: YT W
text_en:
@LIS Situational Science Textbook
Thank you for your response, then please don't make the title so beautiful next time, because using a class that has been selected or specially trained has the advantage of putting it in the experimental class.
Next time, please stay in a general community country (that is, not a star school like yours, or a school with high-quality students). You can choose some well-known rogue schools (in order not to damage the reputation of the school, please do your own homework. Everyone is inside the circle, just ask you to know) to do the same course, I want to see the real experimental class.
Sorry, because of the low quality of the students in my service school, I do not believe that your method can be used in other middle or lower middle schools. I still think that you put a lot of effort into "acting", which is simply not possible in ordinary schools.

text:
感謝你的回饋，這些提問確實是教師在進行教學改變時，會考量到的問題。
由於每個現場與孩子的調性皆不相同，教師所面臨的困境也隨之不同。無論LIS或合作教師，此系列的初衷，便是希望以影片為媒介，將課程內容做為拋磚引玉，讓這些討論及可能的解方多元地發生。

為讓影片能協助現場教師備課，團隊尋找長期於現場進行教學改變的老師，老師會依據過去經驗、現有的教學時數、段考進度、學生程度做綜合評估，與我們共同設計課程。以下就有限時數內的課程內容、學生進行實驗之習慣與能力、課程前置作業，三點做分享：

一、有限時數內的課程內容
在時數限制下，教完、教好間的平衡，確實是一門學問。
以這堂課為例，教師所設定的學習目標是：「學生習得推理、設計實驗與科學本質的能力」，故在一次段考有限的堂數下，若欲投資在此處，確實會需要在各單元間的練習題數下做取捨，而每位教師取捨的評估依據，便會回到何謂一個單元教「好」的定義與指標，則各學校、教師與家長皆有所不同。在108課綱下，大家也正在逐步努力讓這「好課程」，不單純以分數最為唯一的評估依據（評量方式如何因應新課綱而做調整，可以再討論）。

二、學生進行實驗之習慣與能力
這個班級確實是老師長期耕耘下來的結果，從國一開始就開始訓練孩子進入實驗室，在多次的練習後，培養出做實驗的默契與模式，也可從影片中老師下的指令與手勢中看出端倪喔，非有攝影機或有觀摩教師於現場的緣故（當天現場主要為LIS拍攝夥伴）。當天當然也遇到突發狀況，如：學生操作實驗不如預期、孩子思考卡住怎麼辦，我們也盡可能在影片時數中，呈現出老師細膩的引導。

三、課程前置作業
如何讓孩子在課中願意回答問題、順暢做實驗，在事前的備課中，老師其實也下了許多功夫：做了情境設計、提問調整、實驗器具擺放的評估，目的都是為了讓有限的授課時數內，學生的學習效果可以效益最大化，而這一切也是老師的日常。透過此次留言回饋，團隊同時也反省或許在採訪中，分享備課時的思考歷程，也是很重要的素材。

再次感謝你的用心回饋，我們將持續優化影片內容，讓素材得以協助現場教師創造適合自己班級的課程！若有任何想法，歡迎進一步討論喔～感謝！
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Thank you for your feedback. These questions are indeed questions that teachers will consider when making teaching changes.
As each scene has a different tone with the child, the dilemma faced by the teacher is also different. Regardless of LIS or co-teachers, the original intention of this series is to use the film as the medium and use the course content as a source of inspiration, so that these discussions and possible solutions can occur in multiple ways.

In order for the film to assist on-site teachers to prepare lessons, the team is looking for teachers who have been on-site for long-term teaching changes. The teachers will make a comprehensive assessment based on past experience, current teaching hours, progress of the stage test, and student level, and design the curriculum together with us. The following three points are shared about the course content within a limited time, the habits and ability of students to conduct experiments, and the pre-work assignments of the course:

1. Course content within a limited time
Under the limit of the number of hours, the balance between teaching completion and teaching is indeed a science.
Taking this class as an example, the learning goal set by the teacher is: "Students acquire the ability to reason, design experiments, and the essence of science." Therefore, with the limited number of lessons in a section exam, if you want to invest here, you will really need The choice is made based on the number of exercise questions in each unit, and the evaluation basis for each teacher's choice will return to the definition and indicators of what a unit teaches "good". Each school, teacher, and parent is different. Under the 108 syllabus, everyone is gradually working hard to make this "good course" not only based on scores as the only evaluation basis (how to adjust the evaluation method to meet the new syllabus, you can discuss it again).

2. The habit and ability of students to conduct experiments
This class is indeed the result of the teacher’s long-term cultivation. From the beginning of the country, the children have been trained to enter the laboratory. After many exercises, they have cultivated a tacit understanding and mode of doing experiments. You can also learn from the instructions and gestures given by the teacher in the film. You can see the clues in the video, it is not because there is a camera or the teacher is on the scene (the scene that day is mainly LIS shooting partners). Of course, we also encountered unexpected situations that day, such as: the students' operation experiments were not as expected, and the children were stuck thinking about what to do. We tried our best to show the teacher's meticulous guidance in the film hours.

3. Course prerequisites
How to make children willing to answer questions and conduct experiments smoothly in class? In the pre-class preparation, the teacher has actually done a lot of work: situation design, question adjustment, and evaluation of the placement of experimental equipment. The purpose is to make the limited Within the number of teaching hours, the students' learning effect can be maximized, and all this is also the daily life of the teacher. Through the feedback of this message, the team also reflected that perhaps in the interview, sharing the thought process during the preparation of the lesson is also very important material.

Thank you again for your heartfelt feedback. We will continue to optimize the content of the video so that the material can assist the on-site teachers to create courses suitable for their classes! If you have any ideas, you are welcome to discuss further~ Thanks!

text:
給看不懂的人的說明：
用進廢退說：
『生物後天產生的特徵會遺傳給下一代』
依照此理論舉重選手的小孩生下來就有很多肌肉，因此這個說法是錯的。
（註：這個名字其實不對，的確會用進廢退，但後天的影響除非作用在生殖細胞上，否則是不會遺傳的）

演化論：
『適者生存，不適者淘汰』
相信大家都知道「基因突變」，那麼，如果因為基因突變產生了短頸鹿和長頸鹿兩種生物，由於短頸鹿不容易吃到樹葉，因此被淘汰（滅絕），只剩下長頸鹿。

達爾文M屬性確定
author: Micky Yang
text_en:
Instructions for people who don’t understand:
Use advancement and abolishment say:
"The acquired traits of organisms will be passed on to the next generation."
According to this theory, children of weightlifters are born with many muscles, so this statement is wrong.
(Note: This name is actually wrong, it will indeed be used, but the acquired influence will not be inherited unless it acts on the germ cells)

Evolution Theory:
"Survival of the fittest, elimination of the unfit"
I believe everyone knows about "gene mutations," so if two organisms, short giraffes and giraffes, are produced due to genetic mutations, short giraffes cannot easily eat leaves, so they will be eliminated (extinct) and only giraffes will remain.

Darwin M attribute determination

因為植物的根有像半透膜的功能
就是拿來過濾掉對植物來說沒有用的東西（泥土就是一個example)
我推測螢光劑也會因為它的分子太大而被過濾掉
進而導致實驗失敗。
author: Kiwi Bird
text_en:
I am late too (but if you see a message please tell me if I am right or wrong!)

But for the last question, I don’t think the plants will turn into fluorescent plants
Because the roots of plants have the function of a semi-permeable membrane
It is used to filter out things that are useless to plants (soil is an example)
I speculate that the fluorescer will also be filtered out because its molecules are too large
In turn, the experiment failed.

text:
9:35獨目龍的眼鏡鏡片確實是紅色的

可是在休傑克曼演的第一部X戰警中有一幕：琴的口鼻被黏液嗚住，獨目龍就趕快調整眼鏡上的調節器，控制雷射的強度，可以除掉黏液卻不讓人受傷。

所以我覺得用紅色的鏡片加上其他調整器（像是LIS團隊探究出的角度因素）還是可行的。反而用其他顏色的鏡片就只有阻擋的效果，而沒有調節的功能了。

休傑克曼的第一部X戰警電影距離現在又隔了多久呢？（遠目）
author: 李佳昇
text_en:
9:35 Cyclops glasses lenses are indeed red

However, in the first X-Men performed by Hugh Jackman, there is a scene: Qin’s mouth and nose are wailed by mucus, and the cyclops quickly adjust the adjuster on the glasses to control the intensity of the laser, which can remove the mucus but not. It hurts people.

So I think it is feasible to use red lenses with other adjusters (such as the angle factor explored by the LIS team). On the contrary, the use of lenses of other colors will only have a blocking effect, but no adjustment function.

How long has it been since Hugh Jackman's first X-Men movie? (Far eye)

text_en: The secret of temperature change: At an altitude of about 10 kilometers, there will be a layer of greenhouse gas formed by ozone, which will maintain the temperature at about -40 degrees Celsius or even higher. text:
這系列主題很有趣，不過遊戲王應該不太算超級英雄，而且現在高中以下的學生，其實不太認識遊戲王，最紅的應該是鬼滅。一開始講解反射定律時，法線用虛線來表示比較好，現在的課本、題目幾乎都是畫虛線。
如果真的要重現遊戲王的效果，可能要用高級的全息投影機，只用壓克力板反射應該做不到。
author: binladan911
text_en:
The theme of this series is very interesting, but Yugioh should not be considered a superhero, and students below high school don't actually know Yugioh. The most popular one should be Ghost Slayer. When explaining the law of reflection at the beginning, it is better to use dotted lines to indicate normals. Nowadays, almost all textbooks and topics are drawn with dotted lines.
If you really want to reproduce the effect of Yu-Gi-Oh, you may need to use an advanced holographic projector, which should not be possible with only acrylic reflection.

text:
震波速度和密度不是呈正相關喔，而是負相關。之所以震波速度在深處會比較快，更重要的原因是地層被擠壓、壓縮比變大造成的。
不過動畫畫得很好，解釋為何傳到地函、比較長的路徑反而會比直達波提早到的現象說明得很清楚。
author: 陳國峰
text_en:
The seismic velocity and density are not positively correlated, but negatively correlated. The reason why the seismic wave velocity is faster in the depths, the more important reason is that the stratum is squeezed and the compression ratio becomes larger.
However, the animation is very well drawn, explaining why the long path to the ground letter will arrive earlier than the direct wave.

text:
@LIS情境科學教材 

所以說，關於早到波的部分我可以解釋成，震波四面八分發射然後四面八方地引起「隔壁鄰居」成為新的震源後，接著不斷累積效果後，看起來就像是某個波在走直線（這個看起來像直線的波，在以下狀況我都是指早到波）早到波碰到莫氏面的表面，這些表面也成為震源，除了繼續往地球深層震進去，也一邊震給莫氏面的「隔壁莫氏面鄰居1⋯2⋯3號⋯」還有樓上「地殼鄰居」，（所以我猜應該也會有震波被回送的狀況），而往樓上走的波最終會回到地表。

我的想法重點來了，因為「莫氏面鄰居們1、2、3號⋯⋯」之間傳遞波的速度比較快，而這些莫氏面鄰居們還會再把震波傳給各自的「樓上地殼鄰居」最後到地面，只是「樓上的地殼鄰居」傳遞波的速度比較慢。而震波行進位置若有和偵測站對到的早到波就可以被偵測到。

因此我大概可以理解LIS用地函「表面的高速公路」來解釋了。

如果要照震波的每一個真實去向來畫動畫⋯⋯那就請大家更多多捐款給LIS團隊，讓他們畫出更厲害的動畫吧！😄
author: 李佳昇
text_en:
@LIS Situational Science Textbook

So, about the early wave, I can explain that the shock wave is launched in all directions and then causes the "next-door neighbor" to become the new seismic source. After the effect continues to accumulate, it looks like a certain wave is walking in a straight line. (This wave looks like a straight line. In the following situations, I refer to the early wave.) The early wave hits the surface of the Morse surface, and these surfaces also become the source of the earthquake. In addition to continuing to vibrate into the deep layers of the earth, it also shakes Mo "Neighbors No. 1...2...3 of Mohs Mee next door" and "Crustal Neighbors" upstairs (so I guess there will be shock waves being sent back), and the waves going upstairs will eventually Back to the surface.

The focus of my thoughts is here, because the waves are transmitted faster between "Neighbors No. 1, 2, and 3 of the Mohs surface", and these neighbors of the Mohs surface will transmit the shock waves to their respective "buildings" again. The upper crust neighbor" finally reaches the ground, but the "upstairs crust neighbor" transmits waves at a slower speed. The shock wave can be detected if there is an early wave that is in line with the detection station.

So I can probably understand that LIS uses the land letter "superficial highway" to explain it.

If you want to draw animations according to Zhenbo's real life... Then please donate more to the LIS team so that they can draw more powerful animations! 😄

author: LIS情境科學教材

text:
LIS情境科學教材 
我覺得應該佳昇的說明才是對的
因為地殼本身密度是連續變化的
這時候你可以當成幾何光學中n(r)的變介質問題

你說的應該是惠更斯的想法
但事實上無法用它只是個很定性的說明 
沒辦法解釋主要能量部分的路徑
author: Elias
text_en:
LIS Situational Science Textbook
I think Jiasheng’s explanation is correct
Because the density of the crust itself changes continuously
At this time, you can treat it as a variable medium problem of n(r) in geometric optics.

What you are talking about should be Huygens' ideas
But the fact that it can’t be used is just a qualitative description
No way to explain the path of the main energy part

author: 李佳昇

text:
這個現象要說明起來有點抽象，請大家準備好你的想像力XD
就像影片裡面提到的，「波會往四面八方傳遞」，影片裡面用方向性很明顯的線條是為了幫大家理解，不過其實震波無時無刻都是以自身為中心向外擴散的，而當震波擴散到旁邊的地方時，旁邊的地方就也變成了一個新的震源，不停地往四面八方傳遞震波
雖然在動畫中他看起來是接近觀測站之後才往上跑，但其實在不連續面上的每一點都在往所有方向傳遞震動，動畫裡面只是把震波耗時最短的路徑呈現出來方便理解而已
這個觀念真的有點抽象，要解釋清楚需要大量的心力，而且這個觀念其實是高中甚至大學才會教到的，考慮到各項因素我們決定先避而不談，但沒想到還是逃不過各位細心又聰明的觀眾法眼XD
真的必須給大家一個大大的讚，態度有夠優秀，台灣的未來就靠你們了！！！
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
This phenomenon is a bit abstract to explain, please prepare your imagination XD
As mentioned in the video, "waves will travel in all directions." In the film, the lines with obvious directionality are used to help everyone understand, but in fact, shock waves spread out around themselves all the time, and when the shock waves spread When you go to a place next to it, the place next to it becomes a new seismic source, constantly transmitting shock waves in all directions.
Although in the animation he seems to run up after approaching the observing station, in fact, every point on the discontinuity surface transmits vibration in all directions. The animation only presents the shortest path of the shock wave for easy understanding.
This concept is really a bit abstract, and it takes a lot of effort to explain it clearly, and this concept is actually taught in high schools or even universities. Taking into account various factors, we decided to avoid talking about it, but I didn’t expect it to escape your careful attention. The clever eye of the audience XD
I really have to give everyone a big compliment. If the attitude is good enough, the future of Taiwan depends on you! ! !

text:
@李佳昇  你成功了！超級成功！嗚嗚嗚看到我們的影片真的成功影響到觀眾覺得好感動啊～～
不過影片裏面的這個現象跟你說的有點微妙的差異XD

text:
@LIS情境科學教材  我覺得因為是科學史，呈現當時科學家/界的想法、認知比較好。不過可以中途讓狗狗插進來說明（避免誤會），類似於「可逆反應」時「反應物」、「生成物」的名詞出現方式。
如：
科學家：我認為……
狗狗：其實後來被證明應該是……
或者是像以前片尾科學家和狗狗的對話（Q：……）等方式，也可以在最後科學家照片+後續情況之後以純文字說明。
author: Micky Yang
text_en:
@LISContext Science Textbook I think because it is the history of science, it is better to present the ideas and cognition of scientists/world at that time. However, the dog can be inserted in the middle to explain (to avoid misunderstanding), similar to the way the nouns "reactant" and "product" appear in the "reversible reaction".
Such as:
Scientist: I think...
Doggo: In fact, it turned out to be...
Or it can be the dialogue between the scientist and the dog in the previous credits (Q:……), etc., or it can be explained in plain text after the final scientist photo + follow-up situation.

text:
LIS情境科學教材 我看了你們的對話後覺得，LIS的影片就像是道耳吞提了原子說，它簡單易懂又可以解決大多數的現象。而陳老師就像是道耳吞之後的科學家，他提出了矛盾點與修正調整的地方。

「原子說」雖然有很多放在現代科技眼裡，諸多需要被修正跟調整的地方，但它卻提供了很棒的方向幫助大家思考與討論，並進一步地追求真理。

兩位示範了一次很棒的科學家之間討論呢。
author: 李佳昇
text_en:
LIS Situational Science Textbook After reading your conversations, I feel that LIS’s film is like a Dalton mentioning the atom, it is simple and easy to understand and can solve most of the phenomena. And Teacher Chen is like a scientist after Dawton, he put forward contradictions and corrections.

Although "Atomic Theory" has many places that need to be corrected and adjusted in the eyes of modern technology, it provides great directions to help everyone think and discuss, and further pursue the truth.

The two demonstrated a great discussion between scientists.

text:
您好，我是LIS的教材製作總監弼升
感謝您仔細的觀看以及回饋，這邊與您解釋為什麼團隊會在影片中呈現「密度與波速成正相關」想法的前因後果。
LIS在製作科學史影片時，希望能夠呈現「當時科學家的想法」，來讓孩子了解以及學習科學家想事情的方式。但是在查找莫氏的相關資料時，團隊查詢不到他當時的論文及手稿，因此僅能使用一些比較可信的網站對莫氏的評論資料，像是維基百科的莫氏不連續面英文介面、可汗學院介紹莫氏不連續面的影片等等，都有提到莫氏「當時的認知」是認為密度與波速成正相關，因此我們就大膽的假設莫氏當時認為「密度與波速成正相關」，來呈現影片中的內容。
不過並未在片中指出這個概念其實已經與現代的所知不符，確實是我們做得不盡完善的地方，我們之後會把相關資訊補充在資訊欄內
真的十分感謝您願意指出我們的不足，之後還請您不吝指教，謝謝！！
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Hello, I’m Bi Sheng, LIS’s teaching material production director
Thank you for your careful watching and feedback. Here I will explain to you why the team presents the cause and effect of the idea that "density and wave speed are positively correlated" in the video.
When LIS makes science history films, it hopes to present the "thoughts of scientists at the time" so that children can understand and learn how scientists think about things. But when looking for relevant information about Mohs, the team could not find his papers and manuscripts at the time, so it can only use some more credible websites to comment on Mohs, such as the discontinuous English interface of Mohs on Wikipedia. , Khan Academy’s video introducing the discontinuous surface of Mohs, etc., all mentioned that Mohs’ “cognition at the time” believed that density was positively correlated with wave speed. Therefore, we boldly assumed that Mohs believed that “density and wave speed were Positive correlation" to present the content in the video.
However, it is not pointed out in the film that this concept is actually inconsistent with modern knowledge. It is indeed something we have done imperfectly. We will add relevant information in the information column later.
Thank you very much for your willingness to point out our shortcomings, and I would like to ask you for your advice afterwards, thank you! !

text:
您好，先謝謝您給的回饋。
本次實驗原先經過計算，在考量過質量、撞擊面積、單位面積所受壓力等因素後，算出在1.15公尺的高度時，有機會將玻璃打破。
但是在實際操作時，卻發現無法有效控制結構穩定性，所以在考量過後更改實驗，不直接以位能轉換動能方式來驗證，而是盡可能確認玻璃支撐結構可以完整承受衝擊力，並測出用多快的速度可以打破玻璃，然後再去反推需要多高的高度來轉換位能。
最後我們沒有成功打破玻璃，我們知道硬要打破的話，只要持續縮小撞擊面積肯定有機會，也能算出需要多高的高度。但在測試後，我們認為在還沒成功打破的情況下，那個衝擊力就足以讓人受傷了，所以認為電影中的狀況在現實中不易發生。
當然，本次實驗有不少意外，導致得出來的結論比較有討論空間。團隊在實驗後已認真檢討，從中吸收經驗，也承諾未來在設計實驗時會更謹慎，也希望未來的影片品質，能重新獲得您的喜愛。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Hello, thank you in advance for your feedback.
This experiment was originally calculated. After considering factors such as mass, impact area, and pressure per unit area, it was calculated that at a height of 1.15 meters, there was a chance that the glass would break.
However, in actual operation, it was found that the stability of the structure could not be effectively controlled, so the experiment was changed after consideration, instead of directly verifying by the way of potential energy conversion kinetic energy, but as far as possible to confirm that the glass support structure can fully withstand the impact force, and measured How fast can you break the glass, and then reverse how high is needed to convert the potential energy.
In the end, we did not succeed in breaking the glass. We knew that if we had to break it, as long as we continued to reduce the impact area, we would certainly have a chance, and we would be able to figure out how high it would be. But after the test, we think that the impact is enough to hurt people if it has not been successfully broken, so we think that the situation in the movie is not easy to happen in reality.
Of course, there are many accidents in this experiment, which leads to more room for discussion. After the experiment, the team has carefully reviewed and learned from the experience, and promised to be more cautious in designing experiments in the future, and hope that the quality of future movies can regain your favorite.

Of bliss. Namo Amitabha.

With the merits of Amitabha's immeasurable longevity, I wish to take in all the destined sentient beings enlightened by ○ ○ ○ XX, and wish to take advantage of the Buddha's power, rely on the Buddha's merits, and eternally escape from the sea of suffering of reincarnation of life and death, and the bliss of permanent residence in the rebirth and Nirvana. Namo Amitabha.

Pray for loved ones
Pray for the merits of Amitabha's immeasurable longevity, and protect ○ ○ ○ XX, eliminate disasters and avoid difficulties, but prolong the year of illness, increase blessing and prolong life, six o'clock auspicious, fulfill all wishes, believe in the Buddha and recite the Buddha, and live bliss. Namo Amitabha.

Pray for the sick
○ ○ XX, if the life span is not reached, pray for Amitabha's blessing and recover quickly; if the life span is over, pray that Amitabha will lead him to the Pure Land of Life. Namo Amitabha.


Singapore & Malaysia Pure Land Buddhism Singapore & Malaysia Pure Land Buddhism

Synchronous] Pure Land Buddhism chanting online

It’s not a weight issue, but the rope is too long, and it disperses the force of the centrifugal throw, the heavier you put it.

Why the slingshot can shoot so far? Because the rubber is elastic, the force from the beginning to the end is on the rubber cord

text:
分裂時染色體大小不同，上下對稱真的很清楚耶
但是拍動畫時如果能用3對顯示就好了
學生常常分不清楚2對跟雙套，主要就是因為課本圖只有2對

看到第5遍之後又發現減數分裂時第一次分裂跟第二次分裂的排列方式都不正確
特別是第一次分裂→成對的要排在一起往兩邊分離→這才是「對稱」的真諦啊！
排列是確保分離正確的關鍵，很多突變都是在排列時發生問題的
只是國中把分裂細節拿掉了，所以看不出它的重要性。
author: Ruimin Lin
text_en:
The size of the chromosomes is different during division, and the symmetry is really clear.
But it would be nice if you can use 3 pairs of displays when shooting an animation
Students often cannot distinguish between 2 pairs and double sets, mainly because there are only 2 pairs in the textbook picture

After seeing the fifth time, I found that the arrangement of the first division and the second division during meiosis is not correct.
Especially the first split → the pair should be lined up to separate on both sides → this is the true meaning of "symmetry"!
Arrangement is the key to ensure correct separation. Many mutations are caused by problems in arrangement.
It's just that the middle school has removed the details of the division, so I can't see its importance.

text:
不需要什麼特殊方法，只有單套染色體還是可以發育成胚胎喔，不過就會是個很脆弱很多缺陷的個體
精細胞與卵細胞只要結合就會變成受精卵，並且開始細胞分裂，這個進程並不會受到染色體是否正確結合所影響，精卵細胞內的染色體就算有問題還是會繼續發育，像某些天生的病症（如唐氏症）就是因為精卵結合時染色體數目不正常所導致的。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
No special methods are needed. Only a single set of chromosomes can still develop into an embryo, but it will be a very fragile individual with many defects.
As long as the sperm cell and the egg cell are combined, they will become a fertilized egg and start cell division. This process will not be affected by whether the chromosomes are properly combined. Even if there are problems with the chromosomes in the sperm and egg cells, they will continue to develop, like some natural diseases ( Such as Down's syndrome) is caused by the abnormal number of chromosomes when the sperm and egg are combined.

There are indeed only half of the chromosomes~
After the sperm cells are combined with the egg cells, the cells will start to divide into embryos. Whether the chromosomes are properly combined does not affect this process. Therefore, we often hear that some natural diseases such as Down's syndrome (one more chromosome) are due to the beginning Caused by defective chromosomes
Only one set of chromosomes can still develop into an embryo, but it will be an embryo full of defects, the kind that is easy to die.

text:
身為第一屆的心得：（自然科方面）
素養考題方面：
學校之前有出過一份素養考題，當作考探究與實作的段考，可是我覺得題目為了講究「素養」而流於簡單，因為它從頭到尾都給你一些實驗結果、短文,問你操縱變因、應變變因，結果書讀不多但邏輯良好的同學考得跟讀很多的同學分數差不多，其實對很努力的同學有點不公平......

考題中跨科思考的部分，我很吃虧，之前有寫過題目擷取古典詩詞中一段，問你自然科知識，我因為國文不好所以解不出來，若改為直接問的話我其實可以答對。那這樣，自然分數不也牽扯到國文分數，對國文不好的同學就有點可惜

教材方面：
基礎生物的順序是細胞學、遺傳、演化，似乎是仿照campell的順序，然而把遺傳學擺在前面我認為不佳，遺傳學需要一些的化學底子，往年都擺在選修生物，現在擺在高一，其實對化學發展還不成熟的人很辛苦

物理化學的話我是沒在聽課QQ
author: Li-wen Liu
text_en:
As the first experience: (in terms of natural science)
Literacy test questions:
There was a literacy test before in the school, which was used as a paragraph test of inquiry and practice, but I think the question is simple for the sake of "literacy", because it gives you some experimental results, short essays, and questions from beginning to end. You manipulate the variable cause and the variable cause. As a result, students who read not many books but have good logic scores are about the same as those who read a lot. In fact, it is a bit unfair to students who work hard...

I suffered a lot from the cross-subject thinking part of the exam questions. I wrote a section of the question extracting classical poetry and asked you about the knowledge of natural sciences. I can’t figure it out because of the poor Chinese language. If I ask directly, I can actually get the answer right. . In this way, the natural score is not also related to the Chinese score, which is a pity for students who are not good at Chinese.

Teaching materials:
The order of basic organisms is cytology, heredity, and evolution, which seems to be modeled on the order of campell. However, I think it is not good to put genetics first. Genetics requires some basic chemistry. In the past years, it was placed in elective organisms. Now it is placed high. 1. In fact, it is very hard for people who are not yet mature in the development of chemistry

In terms of physical chemistry, I'm not listening to QQ

text:
1. 可能是不同月份降雨頻率差異 導致滿足第一項與第二項條件與否而造成的曬鹽產量差異
2. 可嘗試蒐集 月份-總降雨量 關係圖 黏土與砂土比例-雨量 關係圖

這種教育才是真正鍛鍊學生的思考能力
而不是在那死記硬背
一堆人都以為分數高就是很厲害很聰明
卻只是以短期記憶達成高分
甚至還有人崇尚什麼背多分的學習技巧 結果過幾年就忘了 根本沒屁用
只能說這種考試機器是當今毒瘤考試導向教育的產物 實屬悲哀
  
自己思考過 理解過的 才是真正學會 
而且這種學法不管過多久都不會忘 因為當你再次被問到時 你已經擁有推敲此問題的邏輯路線
author: 一一一
text_en:
1. It may be that the difference in the frequency of rainfall in different months leads to the difference in the yield of sun-dried salt caused by whether the first and second conditions are met or not
2. Try to collect the month-total rainfall relationship diagram and the clay to sand ratio-rainfall relationship diagram

This kind of education is really training students' thinking ability
Instead of memorizing it by rote
A bunch of people think that a high score is very powerful and smart
But only achieved high scores with short-term memory
There are even people who admire learning skills that are more memorable, but they forget it after a few years. It’s useless at all.
It can only be said that this kind of examination machine is the product of today's cancer examination-oriented education. It is really sad.
  
What you have thought about and understood is what you really learn
And this kind of study will not be forgotten no matter how long it takes, because when you are asked again, you already have a logical route to consider this question.

text:
畢竟素養考題就是比過往更強調能力，所以邏輯能力好的人比知識量多的人在面對素養考題時的確更有優勢。不過這也表示，未來社會，比起知識人才，更需要的是能力型的人吧

至於跨科思考，我的立場是我不認為古典詩詞在未來能力導向的社會還需要像過往一樣被強調，所以我可以跟你一起憤慨這個部分XD

教材的部分，我猜可能是想讓學生跟著正確的科學發展脈絡去走吧，我們的生物科學史也是照這個順序走的，如果能在每一個環節都理解的話（說得簡單XD），這個順序我是覺得還行啦　by 大木
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
After all, literacy test questions emphasize ability more than in the past, so people with good logical ability do have an advantage in facing literacy test questions than people with more knowledge. But this also means that in the future society, more capable people will be needed than intellectual talents.

As for cross-disciplinary thinking, my position is that I don’t think classical poetry needs to be emphasized in the future ability-oriented society as in the past, so I can anger this part with you. XD

The part of the textbook, I guess I want students to follow the correct scientific development context. Our history of biological science also follows this order. If we can understand every link (to put it simply XD), this I think the order is okay by Oki

text_en: Congratulations on the correct answer~~~~~ Because the more coils are wound, the higher the density of the coils, the stronger the magnetic force generated, the stronger the attraction and repulsion with the magnet, the greater the vibration amplitude, and the greater the volume, so The answer is 1 yes! !

text:
我覺得會先變大聲，但線圈數到一定程度後反而會因為電流不足導致變小聲，畢竟線圈本身還是有電阻的，而且手機也沒那麼強的電流。如果真的纏越多越大聲，那音響為何還要插電？

匝數多磁場會增強沒錯，磁場增強導致振幅變大也沒錯。但匝數多電阻也會相對提升，電流會變小；電流變小，磁場變小；磁場變小，振幅也會變小。
author: 廖柏丞
text_en:
I think it will become louder first, but after the coil is counted to a certain level, it will become quieter due to insufficient current. After all, the coil itself still has resistance, and the mobile phone does not have that strong current. If the more twisted, the louder the sound, then why should the speaker be plugged in?

It is true that the magnetic field will increase with more turns, and it is also true that the increase of the magnetic field causes the amplitude to increase. However, if the number of turns is large, the resistance will be relatively increased, and the current will be smaller; the current will be smaller, the magnetic field will be smaller; the magnetic field will be smaller, and the amplitude will also be smaller.

text:
根據帕斯卡原理
小針筒的壓力等於大針筒的壓力
而P（壓力）=F（力）/A（面積）
由此可知施力針筒換更大需要較大的施力
author: ethan Duan
text_en:
According to Pascal principle
The pressure of the small syringe is equal to the pressure of the large syringe
And P (pressure) = F (force) / A (area)
It can be seen that a larger force is required to change the force of the syringe.

text:
是「2」沒錯，恭喜正解 ～ 
如果換成更大的針筒，效果會更差！
因為：壓力=施力/受力面積，且液體不能被壓縮 (體積不會改變，會往壓力低的地方移動）；所以，如果把小針筒變大，由於受力面積變大，壓力就會變小，推動B、C的效果就會變差～
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
It’s "2", yes, congratulations on the answer~
If you change to a larger syringe, the effect will be worse!
Because: pressure = force/forced area, and the liquid cannot be compressed (the volume will not change, it will move to a place where the pressure is low); therefore, if the small syringe becomes larger, the pressure will be due to the larger the force-receiving area If it becomes smaller, the effect of pushing B and C will become worse~

text:
是「2」沒錯～ 如果換成更大的針筒，效果會更差！
因為：壓力=施力/受力面積，且液體不能被壓縮 (體積不會改變，會往壓力低的地方移動）；所以，如果把小針筒變大，由於受力面積變大，壓力就會變小，推動B、C的效果就會變差～
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
It's "2", yes~ If you change to a larger syringe, the effect will be worse!
Because: pressure = force/forced area, and the liquid cannot be compressed (the volume will not change, it will move to a place where the pressure is low); therefore, if the small syringe becomes larger, the pressure will be due to the larger the force-receiving area If it becomes smaller, the effect of pushing B and C will become worse~

text:
液態氮會從上方噴出來我認為有幾個原因
1.下方水管的出口有做出壓扁的動作
使得液態/氣態氮噴出時的阻力增加了
2.對於液態氮而言 水管的溫度遠高於本身
的沸點所以當液態氮接觸到高溫的管 會瞬間汽化 並產生壓力 (廢話
那以電學的角度看 上面輸入口和下面噴口的關係可說是串聯 那往上噴的阻力小於往下流的阻力 那液態氮必定往上噴的量較多
author: OAO Albert
text_en:
Liquid nitrogen will spray out from above. I think there are several reasons
1. There is a flattening action at the outlet of the lower water pipe
Increased the resistance when liquid/gaseous nitrogen is ejected
2. For liquid nitrogen, the temperature of the water pipe is much higher than itself
So when liquid nitrogen comes into contact with a high-temperature tube, it will instantly vaporize and generate pressure (nonsense
From an electrical point of view, the relationship between the upper input port and the lower nozzle can be said to be in series. The upward spray resistance is less than the downward flow resistance, so the amount of liquid nitrogen must be sprayed upward.

【影片公告】
以下針對影片重複上傳做說明：
第一次更正：動畫部分有閃白問題，所以我們緊急做了調整後重新上片

造成大家的疑惑真的非常不好意思QQ

@严天浩 I haven't tried the bamboo tube~~~~ I use a real wooden cup!
But... the bamboo tube... I think about it~ maybe because of the thickness of the tube wall, the resonance effect will be discounted. The wooden cup I used is a thin plate. I thought about it when I saw the guitar. I didn't expect the resonance effect to be very good. . If you like a clear sound, you can also use a double-layer glass, but the glass is not easy to drill holes, I also broke the drill and lost nearly 20 to achieve two

text: 1、燈泡的兩隻腳都接在電池身上，既不是正極也不是負極，這接法不會通電。 2、即便它真的有電力，也接對位置，長腳接正極、短腳接負極，兩邊電池沒接在一起，也無法形成通路。 3、假使真的有電，這接法會亮，也沒有說明它會永恆的亮，哪來的永動機？ 結論，最有可能的是黏土會導電，裡面或後面藏在桌子下有接上直流電源，結案。
author: 德
text_en: 1. Both legs of the bulb are connected to the battery, neither positive nor negative, this connection will not be energized. 2. Even if it has power, it should be connected to the right position. The long leg is connected to the positive pole and the short leg is connected to the negative pole. 3. If there is electricity, this connection will be bright, but it does not mean that it will be bright forever. Where is the perpetual motion machine? In conclusion, it is most likely that the clay will conduct electricity, and the DC power supply is connected inside or behind the desk, and the case is closed.

text:
は:ha，這裡當助詞，所以變音，變成wa
舉例：はははどこですか，はは:母親。
不可以念ha ha ha do ko de su ka
要唸：ha ha wa do ko de su ka
意思是，媽媽在哪裡，如果念上面，會變成，哈哈哈在哪裡。
author: 大膽島上的一座牆
text_en:
は:ha, here as the auxiliary word, so the accent becomes wa
For example: はははどこですか, はは: mother.
Don’t say ha ha ha do ko de su ka
To read: ha ha wa do ko de su ka
It means, where is the mother, if you read the above, it will become, where is hahaha.

text: 是沒錯啦，當初在軟流圈的熱對流出現前，大陸漂移學說被臭罵一番
author: sky烈焰焚風
text_en: That’s right, before the asthenospheric thermal convection appeared, the theory of continental drift was scolded a lot.

text: 軟流圈與熱對流所造成的板塊運動在赫登那個時代還沒有出現。事實上，及便是在更為晚期的韋格納，也還沒有這樣成熟的概念。因此這才讓韋格納的大陸漂移說十分薄弱而輕易被其他地質學家所攻破。
author: 嚴融怡
text_en: Plate motion caused by asthenosphere and thermal convection did not appear in Heden's time. In fact, even in the more advanced Wegener, there is no such mature concept. Therefore, Wegener's continental drift theory is very weak and easily broken by other geologists.

text: 我是一个大陆人，偶然发现了你们的频道，太喜欢了，你们的科普已经甩出了大陆科普一个次元，我们虽然也有很优秀的科普频道，但是还是说教的方式。而你们已经真的做到让科学融入常识替代你爸妈教你的知识。激起了每个人对生活的新的认知和兴趣。只看科普频道之间的对比，我大概就能感觉到我们国民素质和科技之间的差距，谢谢你们谢谢民主台湾
author: yixin zhou
text_en: I am a mainlander. I found your channel by accident. I like it so much. Your science popularization has already surpassed the mainland science popularization. Although we also have a very good science popularization channel, it is still a preaching way. And you have really managed to integrate science into common sense to replace the knowledge your parents taught you. Aroused everyone's new knowledge and interest in life. Just looking at the comparison between popular science channels, I can probably feel the gap between the quality of our citizens and technology. Thank you. Thank you, Democratic Taiwan.

text:
資訊有點少，沒關係讓我來猜猜看XD
有講到高跟矮那應該是在說豌豆的高莖與矮莖，這也是孟德爾拿來觀察的其中一個性狀，規律一樣符合他的遺傳學說
所以你後面提到的「高：矮=743：757」應該是在說雜顯性跟純隱性交配後產生的後代，會出現兩種性狀比例接近1：1的現象吧
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Information is a little bit less, it’s okay, let me guess XD
When talking about high heels and shortness, it should be talking about the high stems and short stems of pea. This is also one of the traits Mendel used to observe. The law is also in line with his genetic theory.
So the "high: short = 743: 757" you mentioned later should mean that the offspring produced after the mating of heterodominant and pure recessive will have a ratio of two traits close to 1:1, right?

text:
您好～我們猜想您可能想表達的「種」是表示物種，在這集裡面不管紫花還是白花都是同一個物種，沒有純種雜種的問題～
更精準來講我們應該要用純品系來表達，感謝您提供寶貴的意見！讓我們更進一步的思考以後在用詞方面的精準度～
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Hello~ We guess that the "species" you may want to express means species. In this episode, both purple and white flowers are the same species, and there is no problem of pure hybrids~
To be more precise, we should use pure strains to express, thank you for your valuable comments! Let us think further about the accuracy of the wording in the future~

text:
能看到豌豆花的實驗操作細節真是太棒了，
不用再說到口角生沫，學生還是滿頭問號
不過有個小細節……
「然後把這個紫花的花粉刷到雌蕊上……」依這句話的語意跟後來的鏡頭，這個鏡頭中應該是一朵白花才合理喔
紫花配紫花是自花(不用操作)，紫花配白花是異花(需要操作)

不過簡單把配音跟台詞改一下「然後把這個白花的花粉刷到雌蕊上……」應該就可以了
author: Ruimin Lin
text_en:
It’s great to see the details of the pea flower experiment.
No need to talk about frothing, students are still full of question marks
But there is a small detail...
"Then brush the purple flower on the pistil..." According to the meaning of this sentence and the subsequent shots, it is reasonable that there should be a white flower in this shot.
Purple flowers with purple flowers are self-flowering (no operation required), purple flowers with white flowers are different flowers (operation required)

But simply change the dubbing and lines "and then brush the white flower pollen on the pistil..." it should be fine.

text:
@阿白  的確是靠著自交之後看下一代做區分沒錯。
豌豆發育很快所以所以下一代開花時上一代也還活得好好的，這也是孟德爾選用豌豆的原因之一
author: 李柏漢
text_en:
@阿白 It is true that the next generation is distinguished by self-acquaintance.
Pea develops very fast, so when the next generation blooms, the previous generation is still alive. This is one of the reasons why Mendel chose peas

text: 我一開始是因為我們的理化老師給我們看天體音樂那集而開始注意到你們的影片，而後老師給我們看元素王那集我就深深的愛上了LIS，我每天吃飯看，睡覺前看，無聊時看，馬上就把化學跟物理看完了，看完後把地科也看完，但是地科的影片真的很少！！！！，我每天都在等著地科影片能出更多，但是到現在都還沒有，我開始在想會不會是因為經費不足的問題嗎？，但是我並沒有辦法贊助你們，不然的話我真的非常想要贊助，但是我還只是國中生……所以我只能等到有人能贊助你們……加油！！！！！LIS，我真的很喜歡你們的影片！！！！！

I started to wonder if it’s because of insufficient funding. , But I have no way to sponsor you, otherwise I really want to sponsor, but I am only a middle school student... so I can only wait until someone can sponsor you... 飲片中飲料包裝是直的，加熱後到飲料瓶上是捲曲的，那到了玻璃瓶上為何是直的而不是捲曲的?
author: 初學者東東
text_en:
So what is wrapped on the beverage bottle is a curly plastic molecule? When it reaches the experimental container, it becomes forced to be straightened. So, is it straightened or curled?
The beverage package in the decoction piece is straight, and it is curled on the bottle after being heated. Why is it straight instead of curled on the glass bottle?

text:
這次實驗裡使用的是寶特瓶上的收縮膜，目前寶特瓶上的收縮膜多是採用PET材質，可加熱到140~160度左右，並且也比較安全不會釋放出毒素物質。
在這次的實驗中，是使用吹風機吹，溫度也不至於到140度以上，所以也不需要擔心釋放有毒物質的問題。
當然如果自己做實驗的時候想要拿不同的熱塑性塑膠來測試看看，就需要留意一下使用的材質的哪種，是否會有什麼問題～
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
In this experiment, the shrink film on the PET bottle is used. At present, the shrink film on the PET bottle is mostly made of PET, which can be heated to about 140 to 160 degrees, and it is safer to not release toxins.
In this experiment, a hair dryer is used to blow, and the temperature is not higher than 140 degrees, so there is no need to worry about the release of toxic substances.
Of course, if you want to test with different thermoplastics when you do your own experiment, you need to pay attention to what kind of material is used and whether there will be any problems~

text: 挖塞帥爆，為何油是定時炸彈？
author: 朱昱光
text_en: Why is oil a time bomb?

text: 為什麼油性顏料是定時炸開而水性的則是會直接炸開呢？因為『油會浮在牛奶上，而加入清潔劑時分子需先帶走油脂，才到相對下層的牛奶，後使其中水分子分開』。應該是這樣才造成時間差😘。
author: 陳胤達
text_en: Why do oil-based paints explode regularly while water-based paints explode directly? Because "oil will float on the milk, and when the detergent is added, the molecules need to take away the grease before reaching the lower layer of milk, and then separate the water molecules." This should be the reason for the time difference 😘.

text:
以下摘自《人生大挑戰》
https://m.fwdict.com/challenge/

一位風雲道者說：「元老，你別生氣。因為民間的學校教育所教的東西，有很多都是錯誤的。光是自然科學、星星、太陽、月亮或人類的歷史……通通都是錯誤的，若讓元老去接觸了民間的教育，讀了一大堆書籍，恐怕到時要你寫出『陰間』所見到的真相時，得先費更多功夫扭轉、說服你自己的成見；甚至你寫出來的東西，也會添油加醋、摻入民間書籍的理論。這樣〔陰府〕要傳達給人類的人生真相就不純淨了。」

民間人類死亡時「歲數階段未滿」，還在自由躲藏的靈魂（鬼），因為無法回陰間地府處，所以補充磁流的方式，是以靜磁流氣球體（月亮）溶化降下的露水，在清晨太陽照射蒸發時所散發的磁流，就是祂們充補磁流的來源。祂們會趴在地上吸取這種露水蒸發的磁流。此種磁流很微量，因此有些自由躲藏的鬼，就會自願加入渡畜牲者，成為陰間的工作者，雖然辛苦，但卻有固定的磁流來源—可回陰間地府處充電。

我搔著頭，苦惱地說：「還有，根本沒有『月亮』這回事，我還得寫出來吔！」
	早在我開始靈魂出竅、接觸鍾馗後，鍾馗就告訴過我：天上的月亮不是人類想像的月球。
	原來人類看到天上發亮的『月亮』，在天地五界中，真正的名稱叫做「靜磁流氣球體」。
	歐魯指著螢幕，畫面可見在我們所在位置下方，第三界的高空頂端—有一個白色發光的球體，祂說：「這是在民間所稱的『月亮』，實際上它是『白色透明的靜磁流質體』，升至比白雲更高的天空上，吸纏集體造成更密實的一團白色、發亮的『靜磁流氣球體』，它的本質是透明的氣體，會隨著氣流飄移。」
	我提出疑問：「民間人類不是有人用太空望遠鏡可以看到月球表面嗎？」
	歐魯說：「靜磁流氣球體是透明的氣體，民間人類是朝著這顆透明球體的方位用儀器探索，恰巧所見到的是飄浮在『黑雲板塊』的垃圾團（石灰團），就把這個垃圾團當作是月球。」
	我又問：「這個靜磁流氣球體有什麼作用呢？晚上給人類照明嗎？」
	歐魯呵呵地笑起來：「也許這是附帶的作用吧！靜磁流氣球體是太陽的電池、儲備的磁流；太陽從沼泥界出來運行的路程，會視情況需求—假如民間排放的二氧化碳量不夠太陽使用，就無法提煉足夠的太陽能（電力）—太陽就會去挪用靜磁流氣球體的儲備磁流；通常是在白天吸取，所以在太陽的強光中，人類看不到靜磁流氣球體被飛碟推到太陽旁邊的情景。太陽會酌量溶化靜磁流氣球體，將磁流質回收進入太陽本體使用。」
	我好奇地問：「飛碟把月亮推到太陽旁邊？怎麼推？踢足球嗎？」
	歐魯說：「靜磁流氣球體本來是飄浮在風雲靈界的黑雲板塊下層，當吸纏靜磁流質體後，才往下沈到第三界高空，而隨著氣流飄移；當太陽需要補充電力時，飛碟就會去把靜磁流氣球體移動到太陽旁邊；若恰巧是太陽光線較弱的時段，就會被民間人類看到有類似『兩個太陽』的景象。至於飛碟如何推？我可以告訴你，飛碟是直接鑽入靜磁流氣球體去推動的。」
	我反問歐魯：「靜磁流氣球體不是氣體嗎？要怎麼推動？」
	歐魯：「這說來話長了。當太陽繞轉降落水界區域，會把所提煉的霧體—『白色透明的靜磁流質體』，發射和水纏黏，合體浮流，形成『冰山』。而太陽自出口處浮出地表時，外殼旋轉動氣產生的高溫旋風氣流，會慢慢去溶化『冰山』，再把那些被水纏黏住的靜磁流質體吹到溶化；『白色透明的靜磁流質體』大部分化為白霧氣體，飄浮在空中；此磁流物本身具有磁性，自然會吸纏成團狀—稱之為『白雲』。」
	我認真地聽著，歐魯表示，此趟隨太陽遊考，會讓我親眼目睹這些過程。
	祂又接著說：「那些白色透明的靜磁流質體，飄浮升至更高於白雲之上的高空，吸纏成『靜磁流氣球體』，也就是民間所見的『月亮』—然而這吸纏的過程也有玄機的。」
	我形容說：「是不是就像民間做棉花糖一樣，纏成一大坨？」
	歐魯說：「棉花糖要纏成一大坨，不是需要一根竹棒去繞嗎？靜磁流氣球體的成形，也是有一個吸磁的空心膜球，把所有飄浮到此高度的靜磁流質體吸纏集團。這個吸磁球是太陽星君打造的。待會你可以親眼目睹。」祂又操作著按鈕，讓我觀看月亮的局部影像，在散發白亮光芒以外的部分，我看到黑灰色如蜂窩狀的東西，就如同民間所見的「浮石」，全是密密麻麻的孔。
	我訝異地觀察它的外表，問歐魯：「這顆球有多大呀？」
	歐魯調整了螢幕畫面的縮影比例，回答說：「差不多是太陽的一半大。不過當它吸纏了白色靜磁流質體後，幾乎就和太陽一樣大了；現在它的靜磁流質體吸纏得還不多，所以可以讓你看到裡面尚未被蓋滿的磁球。」
	「就像棉花糖，纏越多，棉花糖就會越大坨。」我想起社子市場賣的棉花糖。
	祂點點頭。
author: 䨻ͤ䨻ͮ
text_en:
The following is an excerpt from "Life Challenge"
https://m.fwdict.com/challenge/

A Taoist person said: "Elder, don't be angry. Because many things taught in folk school education are wrong. Just natural science, the stars, the sun, the moon, or the history of mankind... it's all. It’s wrong. If you let the elders get in touch with folk education and read a lot of books, I’m afraid that when you are asked to write the truth about what you have seen in the "underworld", you will have to work more to reverse and persuade your own prejudices. ; Even what you write will add fuel and vinegar and incorporate folk book theories. In this way, the truth of life that [Yin Fu] wants to convey to humans is not pure."

The souls (ghosts) who were still hiding freely at the time of the death of folk humans who were "under age", were unable to return to the underworld, so the method of supplementing the magnetic current was to melt the dew from the magnetostatic current balloon (moon). The magnetic current emitted when the sun evaporates in the early morning is the source of their replenishment. They will lie on the ground and absorb the magnetic current of this dew evaporation. This kind of magnetic current is very small, so some ghosts who are free to hide will voluntarily join the beasts and become workers in the underworld. Although it is hard work, there is a fixed source of magnetic current-they can go back to the underworld to recharge.

I scratched my head and said in distress, "Also, there is no such thing as the "moon" at all, I have to write it down!"
As long as I started to get out of my body and contact Zhong Kui, Zhong Kui told me: The moon in the sky is not the moon that humans imagined.
It turns out that human beings see the "moon" shining in the sky. In the five realms of heaven and earth, the real name is "magnetostatic current balloon."
Oulu pointed to the screen, and the picture was visible below our location, at the top of the third realm—a white luminous sphere. He said, "This is what the folks call the "moon". In fact, it is "white and transparent." The magnetostatic fluid mass" rises to the sky higher than the white clouds, and it attracts the collective to create a denser white, shiny "magnetostatic fluid balloon". Its essence is a transparent gas, which will follow The air drifts."
I asked: "Aren't people among the people who can see the surface of the moon with a space telescope?"
Olu said: "The magnetostatic flow balloon is a transparent gas, and folk humans are exploring the direction of this transparent sphere with instruments. What they happen to see is a mass of garbage (lime mass) floating on the "black cloud plate". Just treat this trash group as the moon."
I asked again, "What is the function of this magnetostatic balloon? Will it illuminate humans at night?"
Oulu laughed: "Maybe this is a collateral effect! The magnetostatic balloon body is the solar battery and the reserve magnetic current; the distance the sun travels from the marsh mud boundary will depend on the needs of the situation-if private emissions If the amount of carbon dioxide is not enough for the sun to use, it is impossible to extract enough solar energy (electricity)-the sun will use the magnetic reserve of the magnetostatic current balloon; it is usually absorbed during the day, so in the strong light of the sun, humans cannot see the static The magneto-fluidic balloon is pushed by a flying saucer to the side of the sun. The sun will melt the magnetostatic balloon and recycle the magnetic fluid into the sun's body for use.”
I asked curiously: "The flying saucer pushed the moon next to the sun? How to push it? Do you play football?"
Oulu said: "The magnetostatic current balloon was originally floating in the lower layer of the black cloud plate of the Fengyun Spirit World. After the magnetostatic fluid body was entangled, it sank to the upper air of the third realm, and drifted with the airflow; when the sun needs When the power is added, the flying saucer will move the magnetostatic current balloon to the side of the sun; if it happens to be a time when the sun’s rays are weak, it will be seen by civilians as a scene similar to "two suns." As for how the flying saucer is pushed I can tell you that the flying saucer is directly driven into the magnetostatic current balloon."
I asked Oulu, "Isn't the magnetostatic flow balloon gas? How do you push it?"
Oulu: "This is a long story. When the sun revolves and falls in the water world, it will emit the refined fog body-"white transparent magnetohydrostatic body", entangled with the water, and flow together to form an "iceberg". When the sun rises from the exit, the high-temperature cyclone airflow generated by the rotating air of the shell will slowly melt the "iceberg", and then blow the hydrostatic fluids that are bound by the water to melt; "white and transparent Most of the "magnetostatic fluid body" is turned into white mist gas and floats in the air; this magnetic fluid body itself is magnetic and will naturally be entangled into a cluster-called "white clouds"."
I listened carefully. Oulu said that this trip will allow me to witness these processes with my own eyes.
He went on to say: "Those white and transparent magnetostatic fluid masses float up to a height above the white clouds, and are entangled into a "magnetostatic fluid balloon", which is the "moon" seen by the people-but this suction The twisting process is also mysterious."
I described it and said, "Is it like making cotton candy by the folks, twisted into a big pile?"
Oulu said: "The marshmallows need to be wound into a big lump. Doesn't it need a bamboo stick to wind around? The formation of the magnetostatic flow balloon also has a magnetically absorbing hollow membrane ball, which floats all the static magnetism to this height. The fluid body entangles the group. This magnetic ball is made by Sun Xingjun. You can see it with your own eyes later.” He operated the button again to let me watch a partial image of the moon. I saw the part outside of the bright white light. Black and gray like a honeycomb, just like the "pumice stone" seen by the folks, it is full of dense holes.
I looked at its appearance in surprise, and asked Oulu: "How big is this ball?"
Oulu adjusted the scale of the screen picture and replied, "It is almost half the size of the sun. However, after it has entangled the white magnetostatic fluid, it is almost as large as the sun; now its magnetostatic fluid attracts There is not much entanglement, so it allows you to see the magnetic ball that has not been fully covered."
"Like cotton candy, the more you wrap, the bigger the cotton candy will be." I think of the cotton candy sold in the social market.
He nodded.

text: 目前我們的教材是以國小高年級到國中三年級的科學課程下去製作，內容都對應到108課綱， 不過其實國⼩中低年級的孩子已經對於一些聲音、電與磁、燃燒氧化有概念了，所以直接觀看我們的影片是能夠理解的! 如果孩⼦是第一次觀看我們的影片的話，也希望可以由家長陪同，陪伴孩⼦一起思考並引導孩⼦發現科學的有趣！
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: At present, our textbooks are produced based on science courses from senior elementary school to junior high school. The content corresponds to the 108 syllabus. However, in fact, children in junior middle and lower grades already have concepts about sound, electricity and magnetism, and combustion and oxidation. So it’s understandable to watch our video directly! If it’s the first time for a child to watch our video, I hope they can be accompanied by their parents to accompany them to think together and guide them to discover the fun of science!

text:
即使沒有達到沸點，表面的液體也會慢慢變成氣體唷！
當溫度越高越容易蒸發，而到達沸點的時候是全部的液體都在變成氣體，所以就會有沸騰冒泡的現象。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Even if it does not reach the boiling point, the liquid on the surface will slowly become gas!
When the temperature is higher, the easier it is to evaporate, and when it reaches the boiling point, all the liquid is turning into gas, so there will be boiling and bubbling.

text:
沒錯透明醬油的確不是這麼簡單！
稍作查詢，都是説釀造完的醬油，經過獨家的透明化處理後再做最終的調和。
所以我無法斷定那個透明化處理詳細是經歷什麼流程，但猜測應該與蒸餾或是萃取有關。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Yes, transparent soy sauce is not so simple!
A little query, it is said that the brewed soy sauce will undergo an exclusive transparent treatment before the final reconciliation.
So I can't tell what process the transparency process goes through in detail, but I guess it should be related to distillation or extraction.

text:
千萬不要把氫氧化鈣放到嘴裡
影片裡是用氫氧化鈣加水放出高溫來煮熟食物
想想你的嘴巴，都是口水
氫氧化鈣放進嘴巴後會發生什麼事，就不用多說了吧！


關於食入（或吸入）氫氧化鈣
若劑量少的話，就跟咀嚼檳榔一樣（請不要嘗試）
會感到口腔發熱，並對喉嚨與肺部產生刺激
(紅色的檳榔汁或俗稱「紅灰」的檳榔中，就含有氫氧化鈣)


若過量的話，除了灼傷以外，還會有呼吸困難、內出血、肌肉分解、血液pH值增加導致器官受損等症狀
若真的誤食請盡快食用牛奶(以油紙與鹼進行皂化減緩毒性)或檸檬汁(酸性食物中和其鹼性)來緩解症狀
但灼傷可能就沒辦法挽回了
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Never put calcium hydroxide in your mouth
The film uses calcium hydroxide and water to release high temperature to cook food
Think about your mouth, it's all saliva
Needless to say, what happens when calcium hydroxide is put in your mouth!


Regarding ingestion (or inhalation) of calcium hydroxide
If the dose is small, it is the same as chewing betel nut (please don't try)
Feel the heat in the mouth and cause irritation to the throat and lungs
(Red betel nut juice or betel nut commonly known as "red gray" contains calcium hydroxide)


If overdose, in addition to burns, there will be symptoms such as difficulty breathing, internal bleeding, muscle breakdown, and increased blood pH, resulting in organ damage.
If you accidentally swallow it, please consume milk as soon as possible (use oily paper and alkali for saponification to reduce toxicity) or lemon juice (acidic food neutralizes its alkalinity) to relieve symptoms
But there may be no way to recover from the burn

text:
其實語言或是哲學等文科的範疇，也都是奠基在很多的邏輯思辨上去發展的。
以語言為例，像是為什麼我們要有一個共通的語言，而這個語言系統是怎麼建立的；又是在什麼文化背景下，造成不同民族的語言差異的，這些都是在教育上時常被忽略掉的邏輯與脈絡思考。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
In fact, humanities such as language or philosophy are also developed on the basis of many logical speculations.
Take language as an example, such as why we need to have a common language and how the language system was established; and under what cultural background, the language differences of different nationalities are caused. These are often overlooked in education. The logic and context of the lost.

text:
謝謝這麼用心製作的一系列影片，但有一個建議修正：

應該要念「伽ㄍㄚ利略」，而非「伽ㄑ一ㄝˊ利略」哦！
因為念「伽ㄍㄚ」才符合原文(義大利文)念法
就像「伽ㄍㄚ馬射線」，而不是「伽ㄑ一ㄝˊ馬射線」一樣~
希望也藉由您的影片把正確的念法傳遞出去，謝謝！
author: Jessamine Chen
text_en:
Thanks for the series of videos made with such care, but there is a suggested correction:

It should be pronounced "Galilio" instead of "Galilio"!
It’s because of the chanting "Ga ㄍ ㄚ" that conforms to the original (Italian) method
Just like "Gamma ray" instead of "Gamma ray"~
I hope that the correct idea can be conveyed through your video, thank you!

text: @Micky Yang  在2009國際天文年台灣科學界共襄盛舉的一連串活動中已針對此讀音提出修正，教育部的一字多音也說此處應讀作「ㄐㄧㄚ」，但科學界希望還是念「ㄍㄚ」，以示對伽利略的尊重。至少不要再念「ㄑ一ㄝˊ 」，因為這個音是來自梵文。
author: Jessamine Chen
text_en: @Micky Yang has proposed amendments to this pronunciation in a series of activities organized by the scientific community in Taiwan during the 2009 International Year of Astronomy. The Ministry of Education also said that this pronunciation should be pronounced "ㄐㄧㄚ", but the scientific community hopes that Say "ㄍㄚ" to show respect for Galileo. At least don't say "ㄑ一ㄝˊ" because this sound comes from Sanskrit.

text:
小想法:
1.之後真人扮演科學家或許可以多補充一點這個科學家的特色或行事風格在資訊欄，或是在劇情中就提到一下XXX怎麼樣怎麼樣之類的。不然會不太知道為什麼您們選擇這樣詮釋這個角色。
2.如果真人詮釋科學家比較困難，是否有考慮純作動畫的部分，而用一些代表動畫角色來解釋原理即可呢?(有點像台灣吧那樣)，一方面這樣子可以省去每次換裝、想真人腳本的時間。一方面可以專注在動畫上面。
(或是可以參考 台灣吧 實驗科學吧 的幾集，看是否能較為生動地穿插角色與實驗動畫)
以上想法，純屬個人意見，僅供參考，祝福LIS團隊越來越茁壯。
author: 洪鈞亮
text_en:
Small thoughts:
1. In the future, a real person acting as a scientist may be able to add a little more about the scientist’s characteristics or acting style in the information column, or mention how XXX is in the plot. Otherwise, you don’t know why you chose to interpret this role in this way.
2. If it is difficult for a real person to interpret a scientist, is there a part that is purely animated, and some representative animated characters can be used to explain the principle? (a bit like Taiwan), on the one hand, this can save every change of costume , Time to think about real-life scripts. On the one hand, you can focus on animation.
(Or you can refer to the episodes of Taiwan Bar Experimental Science Bar to see if you can intersperse characters and experimental animations more vividly)
The above thoughts are purely personal opinions and are for reference only. I wish the LIS team grow stronger and stronger.

text:
@rou zuch  謝謝說明!!我其實不是反對搞笑與幽默的對話，只是覺得目前的設定有點像是僅把台詞都分配給那些劇情中會出現的角色，會有一定的戲劇效果，但卻不知道那個角色真正的特質，記憶點不深。
(感覺有點像是 每個角色都會講類似的話或時事梗)

例如:在超科少年03：電學祕客法拉第 中，可以看到法拉第展現熱情的方式是，情緒興奮會吟詩作對，對於科學問題又會超級認真看待。
或是有些科學家據說小時候在學校成績不好，或許就能詮釋得更頑皮一些或是活在自己世界中的感覺。
如果貴單位 詮釋科學家時 ，能夠把類似這樣個人特質的元素加進來，或許除了幫助學生對不同科學家更有記憶點，也能順道帶出因為這些科學家的特質，連帶著做出了甚麼樣的貢獻等等。


辛苦了，創業維艱。
author: 洪鈞亮
text_en:
@rou zuch Thank you for your explanation!! I am actually not against the dialogue between funny and humor. I just feel that the current setting is a bit like assigning lines to characters that will appear in the plot. There will be a certain dramatic effect, but I don’t know. The real traits of that character are not deeply memorable.
(It feels a bit like every character speaks similar words or current affairs)

For example, in Super Junior 03: Faraday, the Secret Guest of Electricity, you can see that Faraday shows his enthusiasm by chanting poetry and writing right when he is excited, and taking scientific issues super seriously.
Or some scientists say that they did not perform well in school when they were young, and they might be able to interpret the feeling of being more naughty or living in their own world.
If your organization can add elements like this kind of personal traits when interpreting scientists, it may not only help students have more memory of different scientists, but also bring out what kind of contributions these scientists have made because of the traits of these scientists. and many more.


Working hard, starting a business is difficult.

text: LIS團隊曾經帶著自己的教學影片去偏鄉，側錄同學看影片的反應，發現孩子們對於演員搞笑的地方最容易有反應及印象；目前LIS的動畫方向是重在科學邏輯、推論中較抽象的解說～供您參考✨
author: rou zuch
text_en: The LIS team used to take their own teaching videos to remote villages, and recorded the reactions of students watching the videos, and found that children are most likely to have reactions and impressions of the funny places of actors; the current direction of LIS animation is to focus on scientific logic and inference. Abstract explanation ~ for your reference✨

text:
您好～
重點在於那個杯子，有兩個重點
1.杯子裡裝電解質水溶液->可導電
2.杯子下方開了一個洞，接了一條銅線->可連接電池形成通路
所以：
1.與水溶液接觸的銅線是通電狀態，產生磁場
2.中間黑色的東西是條狀強力磁鐵，也有磁場

兩個磁場會互相排斥，銅線因此轉動，轉動方向正好是銅線環形磁場方向的相反。類似銅線環形磁場撞到了一面牆，受反作用力影響往反方向移動。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Hello~
The point is that cup, there are two important points
1. Fill the cup with aqueous electrolyte solution -> conductive
2. A hole is opened under the cup, and a copper wire is connected -> the battery can be connected to form a path
and so:
1. The copper wire in contact with the aqueous solution is energized and generates a magnetic field
2. The black thing in the middle is a powerful bar magnet, which also has a magnetic field

The two magnetic fields will repel each other, and the copper wire will therefore rotate. The direction of rotation is exactly the opposite of the direction of the circular magnetic field of the copper wire. A circular magnetic field similar to a copper wire hits a wall and moves in the opposite direction under the influence of the reaction force.

text: @LIS情境科學教材  謝謝！好詳細的解析
author: 陳昭甫
text_en: @LIS Scenario Science Textbook Thank you! Good detailed analysis

text:
您好！影片內容沒有問題喔！
簡易的理解方式是用安培右手定則，
把兩平行導線中間的磁力線畫出來看方向。

例如A、B兩條平行導線上有相同方向的電流，
用安培右手定則比完後，會發現兩導線中間的磁力線方向是相反的。

假如A的磁力線在兩導線中間是向上，
則B的磁力線在兩導線中間是向下。

讓我們回憶磁力線的定義，是從N極出發到S極的線段，這個定義其實還能被解釋為磁力線上的每一點都能被當做是一個小磁鐵(磁矩)，

這些小磁鐵的N極是箭頭方向，S極則是箭頭相反方向。

有了磁力線的上的每一點都可當作是小磁鐵後，
讓我們回到剛剛畫出來兩導線中間的磁力線，
兩導線在中間的磁力線方向相反，
就代表著有兩塊NS極方向相反的條狀磁鐵放在中間，因此，兩者會相吸。


同樣的，當兩條平行導線有相反方向的電流，
則等同於有兩塊NS極方向相同的條狀磁鐵放在中間，因此，兩者會相斥。


另外，真實的電磁場交互作用並沒有這麼簡單
正如一開始提到的，這是「簡易的理解方式」，
如果需要較為深入的理解，可以搜尋「磁矩」～
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Hello! There is no problem with the video content!
The simple way to understand is to use Ampere’s right hand rule,
Draw the magnetic field lines between the two parallel wires to see the direction.

For example, there are currents in the same direction on two parallel wires A and B,
Use Ampere's right hand to rule after the comparison, You will find that the direction of the magnetic field lines between the two wires is opposite.

If the magnetic field line of A is upward in the middle of the two wires,
Then the magnetic field line of B is downward in the middle of the two wires.

Let us recall the definition of the magnetic field line, which is the line segment from the N pole to the S pole, This definition can actually be interpreted as every point on the magnetic line of force can be regarded as a small magnet (magnetic moment),

The N pole of these small magnets is in the direction of the arrow, and the S pole is in the opposite direction of the arrow..

Every point on the line of magnetic force can be regarded as a small magnet,
Let's go back to the magnetic field line between the two wires just drawn,
The magnetic field lines of the two wires in the middle are in opposite directions,
It means that there are two strip magnets with opposite NS poles in the middle, Therefore, the two will attract each other.


Similarly, when two parallel wires have currents in opposite directions,
It is equivalent to having two strip magnets with the same NS pole direction in the middle, Therefore, the two will repel each other.


In addition, the actual electromagnetic field interaction is not so simple
As mentioned at the beginning, this is the "easy way to understand",
If you need a deeper understanding, You can search for "magnetic moment"~

text:
如果我小孩看這個 學的很糟糕，不是解出問題就較好的製作，從一開始的 完全不懂 蠢材!拿東西砸另一個人....這樣的實驗方法 跟帶故事的過程非常糟糕，我的孩子如果去學校問同學當對方答不出來就罵她蠢材，然後因為做實驗而拿東西砸對方 這樣好像不太對吧


我覺得製作人 跟團隊都應該考慮得更深入 不是只有帶到教育科學這樣 你們大人講話的過程中也會使孩子有樣學樣
author: PEACE LOVE Kim
text_en:
If my child sees that this is a terrible learning, it’s better to make it instead of solving the problem. From the beginning, I don’t understand the idiot at all! Take something to hit another person... This kind of experimental method and the process of telling the story are very bad. If my child goes to school and asks her classmates when the other party can’t answer, he will scold her for being stupid, and then use something to smash the other party because of the experiment. It doesn’t seem right.


I think both the producer and the team should think more deeply. It’s not just about bringing it to education and science. You adults will also learn how to learn when you adults speak.

text:
所以這影片中說的力不是現今所說的力，而是歷史上所說的"活力"嗎？
相同的速度下，質量越大者，運動量(還不是現今的力)越大，應該是笛卡兒提出的吧？不是牛頓
而質量相同情況下，速度越大，運動量也越大，或許也可以順便表達出來
author: Chen Che Yin
text_en:
So the force mentioned in this film is not what is said today, but what is said in history as "vitality"?
At the same speed, the greater the mass, the greater the amount of exercise (not the current force). It should have been proposed by Descartes? Not newton
In the case of the same quality, the greater the speed, the greater the amount of exercise, which may also be expressed by the way.

text:
@LIS情境科學教材  

嗯嗯 抱歉我可能用字也沒有特別修飾，想表達的正如你所說，孩子在學習力特別好的時候會分不清楚玩笑的分寸，即使要使教學有趣我想一定有很多種方法，但是如果是有趣的暴力或是言詞會讓孩子模仿，我們大人懂得什麼時候該說什麼時候該做，但孩子不懂，我曾與父母沒仔細陪伴的孩子我本要教他英文，他經常看YouTube，除了本身問題，回答我的都是大便，白癡，走開，所以我想你們明白我的意思的，期待你們能更進步製作出更好的適教材，也辛苦了，我肯定這個題材教育意義很容易讓孩子吸收，只是過程要在調整我覺得更適合唷
author: PEACE LOVE Kim
text_en:
@LIS Situational Science Textbook

Hmm, I’m sorry I didn’t modify the words in particular. Just as you said, when children are very good at learning, they don’t know where to tell jokes. Even if you want to make teaching fun, I think there are many ways, but If it is funny violence or words that will make the child imitate, we adults know when to say and when to do it, but the child doesn’t understand. I used to teach English to a child whose parents were not carefully accompanied. He often watches YouTube. , Except for my own question, the answers to me are stools, idiots, and walk away, so I think you understand what I mean. I hope you can make better progress and produce better teaching materials. It is also hard work. I am sure of the educational significance of this topic. It’s easy for children to absorb, but the process needs to be adjusted. I think it’s more suitable.

text:
你好，很抱歉讓您看完之後有這些疑慮。
在這邊向您說明那些是我們安排的搞笑橋段，主要是為了讓孩子們覺得有趣好笑，願意繼續看下去，不會像一般的教學影片比較枯燥乏味。
這些搞笑橋段也是用原本的史實誇大演出，像是因為牛頓在歷史上有一個故事是因為他被蘋果砸到，才想出了萬有引力，所以當他在教學生東西落下的加速度，才會有一句，我也是被打到才有feel的，才會有一個橋段是誇大地讓他也用丟東西砸學生。
很抱歉這些橋段會造成這樣的誤解與影響，我們也知道孩子年紀還小的時候，可能會分不清楚玩笑，而做了錯誤的模仿。未來我們也會製作上注意拿捏這些搞笑的尺度，讓演出不失有趣又得體。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Hello, I am sorry to make you have these doubts after reading.
I would like to explain to you that those are the funny sections that we arranged, mainly to make the children find it interesting and amusing, and they are willing to continue watching, not as boring and boring as ordinary teaching videos.
These funny sections are also exaggerated performances based on the original historical facts. For example, because Newton had a story in history because he was hit by an apple, he came up with universal gravitation. So when he was teaching students the acceleration of things falling, there would be In a word, I was beaten until I felt the feeling, and there was a bridge that exaggerated him to throw things at the students.
I'm sorry that these bridges will cause such misunderstanding and influence. We also know that when children are young, they may not be able to distinguish jokes and make wrong imitations. In the future, we will also pay attention to these funny scales in production to make the performance interesting and appropriate.

當時是把東西摩擦後會有相吸或相斥的性質稱為電
木頭摩擦後也會和其他東西有相吸或相斥的現象

author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
At that time, the property of things attracting or repelling after friction was called electricity.
Wood will also attract or repel other things after rubbing
The friction of wood will also be electrified~

text: 我也覺得很讚!!
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: I also think it's great!!

text:
謝謝您的回覆，當初我們猶豫了很久到底是要放當初歷史上的名詞還是現在的名詞在影片中，但為了讓影片更貼近現代與教學現場，才選擇以正負電呈現，也許之後我們會增加字卡，或是在之後發布的文相關本中將這些內容作更完整的呈現。

非常感謝您的建議，由於您的建議也讓製作科學史內容的人感受到您對真實的追求，這對他們來說是最好的回饋。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Thank you for your reply. At the beginning, we hesitated for a long time whether to put the original historical nouns or the current nouns in the film, but in order to make the film closer to the modern and teaching scene, we chose to present it in positive and negative electricity. Maybe we will increase it later. Word cards, or in the textbooks released later, will present these contents more completely.

Thank you very much for your suggestion, because your suggestion also makes the people who produce the scientific history content feel your pursuit of truth, which is the best feedback for them.

text: 您好，我們有收到您的支持！真的非常感謝您！
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: Hello, we have received your support! Thank you so much!

text:
​ @馮傑珉  提供您回覆如下：

波爾塔最主要的著作是《自然魔法》(Magia Naturalis)，這本書裡的內容有包含對磁力的描述，有興趣可以參考文獻或是閱讀Magia Naturalis的英譯本，維基上可以找到。

波爾塔與吉爾伯特的事情可以參考文獻，大致上是吉爾伯特看到波爾塔的自然魔法中關於磁力的描述，覺得很怪所以開始跟波爾塔通信，這邊我們影片強化了這段通信的歷史，結合了一些稗官野史說他們曾經有對決過，才形成這部影片。

參考文獻：
Pull Of History, The: Human Understanding Of Magnetism And Gravity Through The Ages　CH16、17

https://books.google.com.tw/books?id=a4RIDwAAQBAJ&pg=PR31&lpg=PR31&dq=Natural+Magick+magnetic&source=bl&ots=k94q0ScXzq&sig=ACfU3U0TEM4QUMa8-o4SsbtvdWgYVSAgjg&hl=zh-TW&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjDt5PO_uLiAhVNGKYKHZmIAaoQ6AEwB3oECAUQAQ#v=onepage&q=Natural%20Magick%20magnetic&f=false

Paolo Sarpi: A Servant of God and State

https://books.google.com.tw/books?id=zZMXAwAAQBAJ&pg=PA59&lpg=PA59&dq=Giambattista+della+Porta++William+Gilbert&source=bl&ots=eHYkBnn2cY&sig=ACfU3U1BPsX5B4orvTKL9AZaAj1DcFxzlg&hl=zh-TW&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjc4o2p_eLiAhUfyYsBHeIkAh8Q6AEwB3oECAkQAQ#v=onepage&q=Giambattista%20della%20Porta%20%20William%20Gilbert&f=false

揭开电磁学研究序幕的，竟是英女王的一位御医！

http://story.kedo.gov.cn/c/2017-09-26/898080.shtml
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
​ @冯杰珉 Provide your reply as follows:

Porta’s main work is Magia Naturalis. The content in this book contains a description of magnetism. If you are interested, you can refer to the literature or read the English translation of Magia Naturalis, which can be found on the Wiki.

You can refer to the literature about Porta and Gilbert's affairs. Generally, Gilbert saw Porta’s description of magnetic force in Porta’s natural magic, and found it strange, so he started to communicate with Porta. Here we have strengthened the film. The history of this communication, combined with some barnyard official historians, said that they had confronted each other before, and this film was formed.

references:
Pull Of History, The: Human Understanding Of Magnetism And Gravity Through The Ages　CH16、17

https://books.google.com.tw/books?id=a4RIDwAAQBAJ&pg=PR31&lpg=PR31&dq=Natural+Magick+magnetic&source=bl&ots=k94q0ScXzq&sig=ACfU3U0TEM4QUMa8-o4SsbtvdWgYVSAgjg&hl=zh-TW&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjDt5PO_uLiAhVNGKYKHZmIAaoQ6AEwB3oECAUQAQ#v=onepage&q=Natural% 20Magick%20magnetic&f=false

text:
是「功」與「能量」等價喔，所以只要是力的作用都能轉化成焦耳(能量形式)。這種感覺就像是把同一杯水倒入不同形狀的杯子中，雖然長得不一樣，但都是同一杯水。

會有這樣的現象，是因為物理學的真實發展並非是線性的，也不是像課本裡面所寫的是互相獨立的概念，像是能量的概念早在牛頓時期，就被他的死對頭萊布尼茲提出，在當時被稱作「活力」。

在牛頓力學還沒統治世界前，萊布尼茲的「活力」與牛頓的「作用力」互相爭奪誰才是真正的「力學」。最後因為不彈性碰撞能量不守恆的原因，由牛頓所提出的「作用力」勝出。

（補充：上述所提的原因為正史上的紀錄，但「個人認為」這並不構成否決的主要原因，而且牛頓必定也知道活力的合理性，牛頓會不知道摩擦力所造成的消耗？牛頓所提出的第三運動定律，更是讓後人去連結力學系統與能量系統的關鍵之一（虛功原理）。至於為何最後是牛頓勝出，這裡有很多面向可以討論，我們只需知道這場勝利並非單純出自於「誰的理論比較好」，還有其他非科學知識上的想法參雜其中。）

無論是「活力」(能量)還是「作用力」(力)，他們最初被發明時，都是想描述同一件事情，也就是「物體運動的原因」，本質上，兩者並沒有任何衝突，正確性上，兩者也是完全一樣的。

在牛頓力學的權威淡化後，人們開始意識到用牛頓第三運動定律去轉化力學問題，在某些複雜情況下會特別好用。這時，在歷史上最偉大的數學家尤拉的指導下，他的學生拉哥朗日最終完成了一個十分抽象且要有一定數學能力才能理解的理論－「分析力學」，其中用於分析力學運算的「拉格朗日量」，就是「能量」（或稱作功）的形式，之後另一位叫哈密頓的人，從「拉格朗日量」推導出「哈密頓量」，這「哈密頓量」直接描述了能量守恆定理，當然，這一切都只是在數學中所推導出來的，先於任何實證研究前，且至少早了10年以上。

上述這段正體現「能量」與「功(力的作用)」的本質是相同，而且同樣正確，也因此無論怎麼推導，結果都會是一樣的，只是觀點不同，你可以從反作用力、虛功、廣義力的方式去理解，也可以從位能、動能來理解。

之後，提出科氏力的科里奧利提出依據牛頓力學的傳統，發明「功」的定義，並探討「功」與「活力」的關係，看到干涉現象的楊格將「活力」重新定義為「動能」，而後隨著熱力學的發展「熱動說」、「位能」等概念不斷出現，最後，在焦耳的實驗與海姆霍茲的精確論述下，能量守恆定理完成，「能量」與「力」被當作運動現象的兩種描述方式。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
It is the equivalent of "work" and "energy", so as long as it is the action of force, it can be converted into joules (energy form). This feeling is like pouring the same glass of water into different-shaped cups. Although they look different, they are all the same glass of water.

This phenomenon occurs because the real development of physics is not linear, nor is it independent concepts like the textbooks. The concept of energy was used by his dead opponent Leibni as early as the Newtonian period. I propose that it was called "vitality" at the time.

Before Newtonian mechanics dominated the world, Leibniz's "vitality" and Newton's "force" competed against each other for the true "mechanics". Finally, because of the non-conservation of inelastic collision energy, the "force" proposed by Newton prevailed.

(Supplement: The reasons mentioned above are records in official history, but "personally think" this does not constitute the main reason for rejection, and Newton must also know the rationality of vitality. Will Newton not know the consumption caused by friction? Newton The third law of motion proposed is one of the keys (virtual work principle) that allows future generations to connect the mechanical system and the energy system. As for why Newton won in the end, there are many aspects to discuss, we only need to know this Victory does not simply come from "who's theory is better", there are other non-scientific ideas mixed in it.)

Whether it is "vitality" (energy) or "force" (force), when they were first invented, they all wanted to describe the same thing, that is, "the reason for the movement of an object." In essence, there is no conflict between the two. In terms of correctness, the two are exactly the same.

After the authority of Newtonian mechanics faded, people began to realize that using Newton's third law of motion to transform mechanics problems would be particularly useful in some complex situations. At this time, under the guidance of Jura, the greatest mathematician in history, his student La Grange finally completed a very abstract theory that requires a certain mathematical ability to understand-"analytic mechanics", which is used in analytical mechanics. The calculated "Lagrangian quantity" is the form of "energy" (or work). After that, another person named Hamilton derives the "Hamiltonian quantity" from the "Lagrangian quantity". This The "Hamiltonian quantity" directly describes the law of conservation of energy. Of course, all of this is derived from mathematics. It precedes any empirical research and is at least 10 years earlier.

The above paragraph just shows that the essence of "energy" and "work (effect of force)" are the same, and the same is correct, so no matter how you derive, the result will be the same, but the point of view is different, you can learn from the reaction force, virtual work To understand it in the broad sense of force, it can also be understood from potential energy and kinetic energy.

After that, Coriolis who proposed the Coriolis force proposed to invent the definition of "work" based on the tradition of Newtonian mechanics, and explored the relationship between "work" and "vitality". Younger, who saw the phenomenon of interference, redefines "vitality" It is "kinetic energy". With the development of thermodynamics, concepts such as "thermodynamic theory" and "potential energy" continue to appear. Finally, under Joule's experiment and Heimholtz's precise discussion, the law of conservation of energy is completed, "energy" And "force" is regarded as two ways of describing motion phenomena.

text: 石膏是說160g  :  水100g的比例，那實際你們用了多少克做出一個小底盤?硝酸鉀也是比例嗎?還是真的就是60g?
author: 許孟如
text_en: Gypsum refers to the ratio of 160g to 100g of water. How many grams did you actually use to make a small base? Is potassium nitrate also the ratio? Or is it really 60g?

text: 姆姆, 了解了, 感謝回答^^//
author: seven202
text_en: Mum, I understand, thanks for answering ^^//

text: 理論上是的，在降溫（結晶）速率穩定之下，若硝酸鉀的溶解量增加，的確有可能長出更大的結晶。但也有機會因為硝酸鉀過多，導致溶液結晶更容易被擾動，而產生不完整的結晶喔。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: Theoretically yes, if the amount of potassium nitrate dissolved increases, it is indeed possible to grow larger crystals under a stable cooling (crystallization) rate. But there is also a chance that too much potassium nitrate makes the solution crystallization easier to be disturbed, resulting in incomplete crystallization.

text: 1:42 原子量是一顆原子的「質量」，不是重量。
author: ringring543
text_en: 1:42 Atomic weight is the "mass" of an atom, not its weight.

text:
小補充一下，分子量=分子式中所含原子的原子量總和
例如CO2（二氧化碳），C（碳）的原子量為12，O（氧）的原子量為16
所以CO2的分子量（原子量）=44
但是許多人會誤會分子=原子，其實不是
質量÷（分子量）=莫耳數，莫耳數×6×10的23次方=分子
質量÷（原子量）=莫耳數，莫耳數×6×10的23次方=原子
（這樣你懂了吧）
author: sky烈焰焚風
text_en:
A small addition, molecular weight = the sum of the atomic weights of the atoms contained in the molecular formula
For example, CO2 (carbon dioxide), C (carbon) has an atomic weight of 12, and O (oxygen) has an atomic weight of 16.
So the molecular weight (atomic weight) of CO2 = 44
But many people misunderstand that molecules = atoms, but they are not
Mass ÷ (molecular weight) = number of moles, number of moles × 6×10 to the 23rd power = molecule
Mass ÷ (atomic weight) = number of moles, number of moles × 6×10 to the power of 23 = atom
(Do you understand this way)
