text:
期待之後拍萬有引力之爭。牛頓一開始以行星運行是受到離心力與向心力抵銷的錯誤假設計算，於是虎克提出事後被牛頓證明為正確的行星運行受向心力影響且受到的引力與距離平方成反比，然後牛頓靠著他發明的微積分，利用虎克提出的假設證明出萬有引力，然後虎克被KO。

也許可以拍成虎克先以氣功的形式射出「平方反比」氣功攻擊牛頓，然後牛頓使出大絕招「以彼之道還施彼身+微積分大法」把虎克轟回去。
author: Harrison Wang
text_en:
Looking forward to the battle for gravity later. Newton initially calculated the wrong assumption that the planetary movement was offset by centrifugal force and centripetal force, so Hooke proposed that the planetary movement proved to be correct by Newton afterwards was affected by the centripetal force and the gravitational force was inversely proportional to the square of the distance, and Newton relied on his invention The calculus of Hooke uses the hypothesis proposed by Hooke to prove gravitation, and then Hooke is knocked out.

Maybe it can be photographed that Hook first shoots "inverse square" qigong to attack Newton in the form of qigong, and then Newton uses the big trick "to apply the other way to the other body + calculus Dafa" to blast Hook back.

text:
我從影片中計時
從他發射到落地的時間為5.9秒
代表從平地到最高處花了2.95秒
h=1/2×g×t×t
h=1/2×9.8×2.95×2.95
h=42.6
author: ossas OG
text_en:
I timed from the video
The time from launch to landing is 5.9 seconds
It took 2.95 seconds to get from the flat ground to the highest point
h=1/2×g×t×t
h=1/2×9.8×2.95×2.95
h=42.6

我來想想如何算壓力
先把小蘇打跟檸檬酸的反應式寫出來
再把得出的氣體mole數
帶入PV=nRT
是這樣嗎？？
用所學的知識推想答案真好玩XD
我猜雞蛋飛了60公尺~
喜歡LIS滿滿的實驗精神!!
author: 于雅晴
text_en:
Let me think about how to calculate stress
First write the reaction formula of baking soda and citric acid
Then take the number of gas moles
Bring in PV=nRT
Is that right? ?
It's fun to use what you have learned to infer the answer XD
I guess the egg flew 60 meters~
I like the experimental spirit of LIS!!

I have thought of a simpler measurement method
Just pour water into that space
Then pour the water out and measure the volume of the water!

text:
LIS科學頻道 V應該是從雞蛋開關的那個位置算到水管底部的那個空間
就是體積吧！？
量粗細水管半徑算圓面積再求它們的圓柱體積，粗水管連接細水管的那段斜斜的部分應該要用積分算吧...
author: 于雅晴
text_en:
LIS Science Channel V should be calculated from the position of the egg switch to the space at the bottom of the water pipe
It's volume! ?
Measure the radius of the thick and thin water pipes and calculate the circular area and then find their cylindrical volume. The oblique part of the thick water pipe connected to the thin water pipe should be calculated by integral...

text:
前情提要:
古希臘王室給了阿基米德一個難題，要在不刮傷王冠的原則下，知道王冠是不是純金打造的！？上知天文下知數學物理的偉大天才阿基米德，開始在計算一些複雜的算式，看起來超厲害的啦！但，為什麼他要脫光光衝出來傷害大家眼睛呢？

有一天工匠打造了一個塑膠皇冠 可是女王覺得是假der(經費不足 請配合)
後來叫阿基米德找出黃冠是真是假(否則就要幹掉他)
後來他利用浮力原理來測出黃冠重量
測出黃冠是假的(一看就知是假的)
然後工匠就被斷頭了💀
後來她也用槓桿原理
讓一大堆歐巴上拿一堆鏡子(?)
擊退羅馬(?)軍
後來被城內士兵殺死(可惡的士兵)😡😡😡
(看來這個士兵殺死了一個好東西)
阿基米德的智慧對社會做出了無數的貢獻
author: 陳胤達
text_en:
Recap:
The ancient Greek royal family gave Archimedes a problem. Under the principle of not scratching the crown, know whether the crown is made of pure gold! ? Archimedes, a great genius who knows astronomy and mathematics and physics, began to calculate some complicated calculations, which looks super awesome! But why does he want to strip naked and rush out to hurt everyone's eyes?

One day a craftsman made a plastic crown, but the queen thought it was a fake der (not enough funds, please cooperate)
Later, he asked Archimedes to find out whether the yellow crown was true or not (otherwise he would be killed)
Later, he used the principle of buoyancy to measure the weight of the yellow crown
It is found that the yellow crown is fake (it is fake at first glance)
Then the craftsman was decapitated💀
Later, she also used the principle of leverage
Let a bunch of oppas take a bunch of mirrors (?)
Repulse the Roman (?) Army
Later killed by the soldiers in the city (the hateful soldier)😡😡😡
(It seems that this soldier killed a good thing)
Archimedes’ wisdom has made countless contributions to society

text:
不好意思，比較晚回覆你！
希望以下的回答有解答了你的疑惑～

的確無法單純以碳的有無來做有機與無機的分類，二氧化碳就是一個例子，雖然有碳卻是無機的。
並且也如你所說原以為只有生物可以合成的有機化合物，在科學的演進下，現今也能以人工的方式合成有機化合物。

而現在需要區分有機與無機化學的可能的原因如下：

1.官能基與碳結構的相似性：像是「-OH」這種東西掛在相似碳結構上能決定化合物的性質，但必須要套在碳鏈或碳環上才有效果，而這是有機化合物的一大賣點，因此，「有機化學」稱作「碳化學」或許會更合適。

2.雖然可以人工合成，但有機化合物與生物體息息相關這點是無庸置疑的。

3.日常生活常見的高分子聚合物都屬於有機化合物，像是石油、橡膠、澱粉這類都是，只有少部分的高分子聚合物是無機化合物，像是玻璃、寶石、半導體，這類物質的結構與有機高分子類似，可看作是將原本的四價碳置換成四價矽。

因此有機化學之所以能成為化學中獨立的學科，即是有機化合物結構的特殊性，導致其因鏈結與結構的不同，而存在著千變萬化的特性。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Sorry, I will reply you later!
Hope the following answers have answered your doubts~

It is indeed impossible to classify organic and inorganic simply by the presence or absence of carbon. Carbon dioxide is an example. Although there is carbon, it is inorganic.
And, as you said, you thought that only biological compounds can be synthesized. With the evolution of science, it is now possible to synthesize organic compounds artificially.

The possible reasons for the need to distinguish between organic and inorganic chemistry are as follows:

1. The similarity between the functional group and the carbon structure: something like "-OH" hanging on a similar carbon structure can determine the properties of the compound, but it must be attached to the carbon chain or carbon ring to have an effect, and this is A major selling point of organic compounds, therefore, "organic chemistry" may be more appropriately called "carbon chemistry".

2. Although it can be artificially synthesized, there is no doubt that organic compounds are closely related to living organisms.

3. Common high-molecular polymers in daily life are organic compounds, such as petroleum, rubber, starch, etc., only a small part of high-molecular polymers are inorganic compounds, such as glass, gems, and semiconductors. Its structure is similar to that of organic polymers and can be regarded as replacing the original tetravalent carbon with tetravalent silicon.

Therefore, the reason why organic chemistry can become an independent discipline in chemistry is that the particularity of the structure of organic compounds leads to its ever-changing characteristics due to differences in linkages and structures.

text:
這其實是一種叫做"希羅噴泉"(Hero's Fountain)的玩意兒
是因為到水在寶特瓶c之後，寶特瓶c的水流到寶特瓶a，把寶特瓶a的空氣推向寶特瓶b，然後寶特瓶b的空氣把寶特瓶b的飲料推出來，於是飲料就噴出來啦!
其實還有一個原因是因為水從高處時會有位能，所以流下去之後才能進行一連串向上的運動。
那嚴八是不是把寶特瓶a、b都藏在箱子裡，只讓寶特瓶c和飲料噴出來的管子露出來呢？
(不要被神秘兮兮的箱子和嚴八給騙了)
author: 游辰希
text_en:
This is actually something called "Hero's Fountain"
It is because after the water is in PET bottle c, the water in PET bottle c flows to PET bottle a, pushing the air in PET bottle a to PET bottle b, and then the air in PET bottle b pushes the air in PET bottle b. The drink came out, so the drink spurted out!
In fact, there is another reason because water has potential energy when it flows from a high place, so a series of upward movements can only be carried out after it flows down.
Did Yan Ba hide both PET bottles a and b in the box, leaving only PET bottles c and the tube from which the drink was sprayed out?
(Don't be fooled by the mysterious box and Yan Ba)

Once Marian asked a friend to come to the house for a party, but Rumford wanted to stay at home quietly, so he asked the housekeeper to lock the door to prevent the guests from coming in. Marian was so angry about it. Take boiling water to water the roses XDDDD planted in the garden by Rumford

text:
冰淇淋主要原料與成型的原因是鮮奶油喔
所以如果擔心的話，不加雞蛋是沒有問題

另外雞蛋加牛奶煮過的東西，就是「卡士達醬」
也就是泡芙裡面黃黃的餡料，在西點中用途非常廣

卡士達醬的作法是將牛奶與蛋黃，以及適量的低筋麵粉均勻混合後
加入香草精與白砂糖開始熬煮，直到液體呈現濃稠狀
拿卡士達醬用影片中的冷卻方法去製作(記得加入等量的鮮奶油)
就能得到綿密的香草冰淇淋喔
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
The main raw material and the reason for the formation of ice cream is whipped cream.
So if you’re worried, it’s okay if you don’t add eggs

Another thing that is cooked with eggs and milk is "Castar sauce."
It is the yellow filling in the puffs, which is very versatile in pastry

The method of custard sauce is to mix milk, egg yolk, and an appropriate amount of low-gluten flour evenly.
Add vanilla extract and white sugar and start boiling until the liquid is thick
Take the custard sauce and use the cooling method in the film to make (remember to add the same amount of whipped cream)
You can get creamy vanilla ice cream

text:
是蠻讚賞用故事帶出物理的精神啦
不過我以一個家長的看法 這篇有點兒童不宜 個人是蠻希望重做的
1.阿基米德隨便帶小孩回家
2.扯到一些"開黃腔"，雖然沒開，可是不知道到意義何在。小孩根本笑不出來
另外有些建議
a.有些現代實驗指出 阿基米德不太可能做出燒船的壯舉 只是傳說
b.小孩拿出透鏡在地上燒葉子 應該是很好的機會 帶出讓小朋友在家學校 自己做實驗 有點可惜浪廢了
c.火元素 是蠻酷的歷史啦 不過文案解釋時 好像沒有強調這是古希臘錯誤的思路 以小朋友來說 過分強調重複 是不太適宜啦。


精神真的可嘉 不過可能有點網紅化? 太接近20/30歲的笑點。雖然我自己每次看How哥 都笑到不行，可是不代表我會給我小孩看How哥。真心希望LIS能聘用一些爸媽，比較能以小朋友的眼光出發，真正貼近使用族群。加油!
author: JadeDragon Wu
text_en:
I appreciate the use of stories to bring out the spirit of physics
However, from a parent’s point of view, this article is a bit inappropriate for children. I really hope to redo it.
1. Archimedes casually took children home
2. There are some "open yellow accents", although they are not open, but I don't know the meaning. Kids can't laugh at all
Some other suggestions
a. Some modern experiments point out that Archimedes is unlikely to make the feat of burning a ship. It’s just a legend.
b. The child took out the lens and burned the leaves on the ground. It should be a good opportunity to bring out the children at home and school to do experiments by themselves.
c. The element of fire is pretty cool history. However, in the interpretation of the copy, it seems that it is not emphasized that this is the wrong way of thinking in ancient Greece. For children, it is not suitable for children to overemphasize repetition.


The spirit is really commendable, but maybe a little online celebrity? Too close to the 20/30-year-old joke. Although I laugh every time I see Brother How, it doesn't mean that I will show Brother How to my children. I sincerely hope that LIS can hire some parents, starting from the perspective of children, and really getting close to the user group. Come on!

text:
你好，非常謝謝你很用心地給予我們這麼多建議！
1. 關於腳本上面笑點的拿捏，我會轉達給我們的編劇。
腳本的撰寫的確是我們一直在調整的地方，艱澀的科學史內容要撰寫成容易懂的劇情，但不止要能讓孩子容易懂，還要能讓孩子喜歡看並想繼續看下去。
為了達到這個目標，我們會設計一些笑點，但笑點必須拿捏得剛剛好，我們理解有些笑點，對大人來說或許只是玩笑與戲劇效果，但在心智尚未成熟的孩子心中，可能會有被當真抑或是模仿的疑慮。
每次的腳本我們都是花費了很多心力，經過很多次的開會討論後才會定案，很謝謝你的意見，我們也會再加強注意這方面的問題！
2. 歷史上的內容，有關於傳說的故事，還有你指出的現今已被確定是錯誤推測的科學假設，這部分我們會在闡述時做比較好的說明，不要讓孩子有所誤會。
3. 關於加入可以讓孩子做實驗的點子，這部分的內容我們其實是把他拉出來拍攝成另外一支獨立的實驗影片，收錄在我們『LIS實驗室』的系列裡。
4. 找家長顧問是個好點子，我們會納入未來規劃的考慮中！

再次謝謝你的意見與鼓勵！！LIS會繼續加油，製作更多好的科學內容！
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Hello, thank you very much for giving us so many suggestions!
1. Regarding the jokes on the script, I will pass it on to our screenwriter.
The writing of scripts is indeed something we have been adjusting. The difficult content of the history of science must be written into an easy-to-understand plot, but it must not only make it easy for children to understand, but also make children like to watch and want to continue watching.
In order to achieve this goal, we will design some laughs, but the laughs must be just right. We understand that some laughs may be just jokes and dramatic effects for adults, but in the minds of immature children, there may be Doubts about being taken seriously or imitated.
We have spent a lot of effort on each script, and we will finalize it after many meetings and discussions. Thank you very much for your comments, and we will pay more attention to this aspect!
2. The historical content, there are stories about legends, and the scientific assumptions that you pointed out that have been determined to be wrong speculations. We will make better explanations in this part, so that children should not be misunderstood.
3. Regarding the idea of adding a child to experiment, we actually pulled him out and filmed it into another independent experimental video, which was included in our "LIS Lab" series.
4. Finding a parent counselor is a good idea, and we will take it into consideration for future planning!

Thank you again for your comments and encouragement! ! LIS will continue to work hard and produce more good scientific content!

text:
圖案、文字可以用小畫家畫喔，如果進階一點會用其他繪圖軟體也是沒問題。如果不會畫畫的話，可以上網找你喜歡的圖片喔！
不過最重要的是，圖片畫（上網找）完之後，要想辦法把它反轉成負片的形式，網路上有很多免費線上轉負片的網站～
順便考考你們，為什麼要用負片呢？
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Patterns and text can be drawn by a small painter. If you are more advanced, you can use other drawing software. If you don’t know how to paint, you can find pictures you like online!
But the most important thing is that after the picture is drawn (searched on the Internet), you must find a way to reverse it into a negative form. There are many free online negative conversion websites on the Internet~
By the way, why do you use negative film?

text: 燃素派表示：燃燒會把燃素釋放出去，氣體固然會變多。但是根據史塔爾的說法，同時外面的空氣會進到金屬裡面。而且進去的空氣比釋放的燃素多，所以金屬質量變重，而且空氣變少。如果是燃燒一張紙，釋放燃素之後，外面空氣無法填入紙中。紙的質量變少，還會釋放額外的物質到空氣中。
author: 鄭志鵬
text_en: Phlogistonists say that combustion will release phlogiston, and the gas will increase. But according to Starr, at the same time the outside air will enter the metal. Moreover, more air enters than phlogiston released, so the metal mass becomes heavier and the air becomes less. If you burn a piece of paper, after releasing phlogiston, the outside air cannot fill the paper. The quality of the paper decreases, and additional substances are released into the air.

text:
沒錯~燃素派對於金屬燃燒會變重的解釋方式就是以燃素比空氣輕作為假設，不過這樣的假設反而比較像是為了解釋重量問才找出來的理由，而且在燃素體系中發現的氣體都有一個的問題，那就是可以找出像是"脫燃素氣體"、"燃素化氣體"等等基於燃素衍生出的物質，但不管怎麼找都無法找出燃素，最後燃素說嚴格來說不算是被氧化學說打敗，因為相信燃素的科學家在他們死前都相信燃素存在，但在時間的作用下遲遲找不到"燃素"的燃素說，也只能就被更完整的氧化學說給淘汰了。
在影片中，拉瓦節因為不認同燃素說對金屬燃燒現象的解釋，進而發展出氧化理論，就現在看來，拉瓦節能跳出原本的框架去思考真的相當厲害呢
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
That’s right~ The phlogistonist’s way of explaining that the burning of metals will become heavier is to assume that phlogiston is lighter than air, but this assumption is more like a reason to be found out to explain the weight, and the gases found in the phlogiston system are all One problem is that it is possible to find substances derived from phlogiston such as "dephlogisticated gas" and "phlogisticated gas", but no matter how to find it, it is impossible to find phlogiston. In the end, phlogiston is not strictly speaking. The oxidation theory was defeated because scientists who believed that phlogiston believed that phlogiston existed before they died, but under the influence of time, the phlogiston theory of "phlogiston" could not be found, and it can only be eliminated by the more complete oxidation theory.
In the film, Lava Festival did not agree with the phlogiston theory to explain the phenomenon of metal combustion, and then developed the oxidation theory. From now on, Lava Energy-saving thinking outside the original framework is really quite powerful.

反應會遇到一個問題是：怎麼樣都不會全部變成生成物或是全部變成反應物～
但是多少會變成生成物，多少會變成反應物，究竟是誰決定的～就像是這間教室裡有多少人是依據教室大小而定一樣
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
The reaction will encounter a problem: no matter how it will all turn into products or all turn into reactants~
But how many will become products, how many will become reactants, who decides ~ just like how many people in this classroom are determined by the size of the classroom

author: 小魚丸
text_en: It is not only the rural areas that need to be improved. Taiwan’s overall education system must be improved. Those who are truly motivated to learn are probably only the triumphant group that can survive under the system, or even fewer. The school does not necessarily have to give students a lot of money. Knowledge, the ability to cultivate "exploration" and "learning" is even more important.

text:
泰哥，你有當老師的朋友嗎？
我是有些當老師的朋友，年紀約在三十歲左右。
三十幾歲的我，在我自己求學的階段，我是被打上來的，所以我自己認為以前的老師很好當。
現在呢？一來我想是我那些當老師的朋友年輕吧，不管在教法或教材，也有自製教具，聽到這些都覺得老師不簡單
author: 阿寶
text_en:
Brother Tai, do you have a friend who is a teacher?
I am some friends who are teachers, about 30 years old.
When I was in my thirties, I was beaten up when I was studying on my own, so I thought my former teacher was a good one.
What now? First of all, I think it’s my friends who are teachers who are young. Whether they are in teaching methods or textbooks, they also have self-made teaching aids. When I hear these, I feel that teachers are not easy.

text:
不好意思，我做一下關於物理化學相關的歷史補充XD
這就所謂的伏打電池，在很以前很以前有一個義大利醫生叫路易吉·伽伐尼，他有一天在解剖青蛙的時候，發現到每一次刀子用下去的時候，青蛙的腳就會跳動一下，他稱這一現象為動物電。亞歷山卓·伏打 想到青蛙的腳既然是電的導體也是電流的檢測器。
他把青蛙的腳換成鹽水浸泡過的紙，並用其它方法檢測電流。他發現了原電池的電動勢等於兩個電極電勢之的差的定律。這在後人人被稱為伏打定律。
備註 : 務必要兩種不同的金屬及一種電解液，電解液如 : 舒跑、血、氫氧化鈉水溶液、硫酸這些都是屬於電解液的一種
像現在的電池有很多種還有分可充電式跟不可充電式的電池，可充電式：你手機裡的鋰電池、蓄電池等的；不可充電式：乾電池、濕電池、鹼性電池等的電池；只要是在市面上所到的電池疑慮都是用兩種不同的金屬跟一種電解液做成的。
備註：鹼性電池的電解液因為有加二氧化錳跟澱粉的關係，所以鹼性電池的電解液會稠稠的，不可充電式電池一但充下去，是極有可能會發生危險的喔，你在家可以拆拆看你家的電池，但建議不要拆鹼性電池，因為鹼性電池的電解液是強鹼，鉛蓄電池也建議不要拆因為電解液是硫酸，鎳鎘電池跟鎳氫電池野建議不要拆，因為電解液也都是強鹼ＸＤ
author: 小威
text_en:
Sorry, I will do a supplementary XD about the history related to physical chemistry
This is the so-called voltaic battery. A long time ago, there was an Italian doctor named Luigi Galvani. When he was dissecting a frog one day, he found that every time the knife was used, the frog’s feet would With a beating, he called this phenomenon animal electricity. Alessandro Volta thought that since the frog's feet are electrical conductors, they are also current detectors.
He replaced the frog's feet with paper soaked in salt water and used other methods to detect the current. He discovered the law that the electromotive force of the galvanic cell is equal to the difference between the potentials of the two electrodes. This is known as the law of Volta in later generations.
Remarks: Two different metals and one electrolyte must be used. Electrolytes such as Shupao, blood, sodium hydroxide aqueous solution, and sulfuric acid are all electrolytes.
There are many types of batteries nowadays, including rechargeable and non-rechargeable batteries. Rechargeable: lithium batteries, accumulators, etc. in your mobile phone; non-rechargeable: dry batteries, wet batteries, alkaline batteries, etc. ; As long as the doubts about batteries on the market are made of two different metals and one electrolyte.
Remarks: The electrolyte of alkaline batteries is related to the addition of manganese dioxide and starch, so the electrolyte of alkaline batteries will be thick. Once a non-rechargeable battery is charged, it is extremely likely to be dangerous. You can disassemble the batteries in your home at home, but it is recommended not to disassemble alkaline batteries, because the electrolyte of alkaline batteries is a strong alkali, and lead batteries are also recommended not because the electrolyte is sulfuric acid, nickel-cadmium batteries and nickel-metal hydride batteries It is recommended not to disassemble, because the electrolyte is also strong alkali XD

text:
呵呵 量看看電流 我相信應該在0.1A以下 拿來充手機的電 大概要10~20小時才會滿....
而且若電池沒有密封 電解液會揮發 所以每隔兩小時至4小時要注意一下 補充水分....
補充一下 隨時間電解液減少 電極腐蝕 電流也隨之降低 所以充電時間可能會增加到20~40小時....  另外要注意 每一層的紙-電解液 不能互相接觸到 否則視同短路
author: 歸虛
text_en:
Haha, take a look at the current. I believe it should be below 0.1A to charge the mobile phone. It will be full in about 10-20 hours...
And if the battery is not sealed, the electrolyte will volatilize, so pay attention to replenish moisture every two to four hours...
To add, over time the electrolyte decreases, the electrode corrodes and the current also decreases, so the charging time may increase to 20~40 hours...In addition, it should be noted that the paper-electrolyte of each layer should not be in contact with each other, otherwise it will be regarded as a short circuit.

text:
1.基本上手機都有一定的電壓保護
所以接反其實不會馬上爆炸
2.鋁氧化形成鋁離子
與另一邊水還原的OH-形成Al(OH)3
3就算反應完全 硬幣本身也不會發生任何改變 因為它的功能只是個電極 負責把電子傳給水
author: 黃俊翔
text_en:
1. Basically mobile phones have a certain voltage protection
So the wrong connection will not explode right away
2. Aluminum oxidizes to form aluminum ions
Form Al(OH)3 with the OH-reduced by water on the other side
3 Even if the reaction is complete, the coin itself will not change because its function is just an electrode, which is responsible for transmitting electrons to the water.

Under what circumstances will the current stop? If you follow your diagram, it seems that you can keep circulating. This is unreasonable, isn't it?

text: 電流不大還有一個方法可解決，就是疊更多的一塊錢，讓電壓上升到24V左右，再用降壓模組降到適合的電壓，因為即使它電流沒有上升，但是電壓上升導致它的電能還是會比較高，這時將電壓降回來之後，電流就會上升，當然降壓會導致電能耗損，不過應該還不至於影響太大
author: 百花怒放
text_en: There is still a way to solve the problem of low current, which is to stack more money, let the voltage rise to about 24V, and then use a step-down module to reduce it to a suitable voltage, because even if its current does not rise, the voltage rise will cause its The electrical energy will still be relatively high. At this time, after the voltage is dropped back, the current will rise. Of course, the voltage drop will result in electrical energy loss, but it should not have too much impact.

text:
LIS科學頻道 
呃.....記得這好像學校有教過，電能恆定時，電壓越高電流越小，電壓越低電流就越高，高壓電線耗低，低電壓線耗高，線耗高的副作用就是產生熱，解決方法就是增加線徑，所以電廠送電出來時，會直接送345KV就是這原因，高電壓低電流線耗低，而且不用太粗的電線，這樣才能減少送電成本
author: 百花怒放
text_en:
LIS Science Channel
Uh... I remember that this seems to be taught in the school. When the electric energy is constant, the higher the voltage, the smaller the current, and the lower the voltage, the higher the current. The high-voltage wire consumes low, the low-voltage wire consumes high, and the side effect of high wire consumption is To generate heat, the solution is to increase the wire diameter, so when the power is sent out, the power plant will send 345KV directly. This is the reason. The high voltage and low current wire consumes low, and there is no need for too thick wires, so as to reduce the power transmission cost.

text: 影片中的解釋方式，會變成銅是擔任氧化劑負責接受電子，但這邊銅只是當作惰性電極負責傳導電子，負責接受電子的其實是氫離子，還原之後產生氫氣!!其實可以去查查看鋁的氧化電位、銅的還原電位、還有氫的還原電位，就會發現其實是氫離子去接受電子，這邊就算把銅換成活性低的金屬或是石墨，產生的電壓也相同，所以建議原理的地方應該描述的更加正確!!
author: YY Lin
text_en: The explanation in the film will become that copper acts as an oxidizer and is responsible for accepting electrons, but copper is only used as an inert electrode to conduct electrons. It is actually hydrogen ions that are responsible for accepting electrons. Hydrogen is produced after reduction! In fact, you can look at aluminum. The oxidation potential of copper, the reduction potential of copper, and the reduction potential of hydrogen, you will find that hydrogen ions are actually used to accept electrons. Here, even if copper is replaced with a low-activity metal or graphite, the voltage generated is the same, so it is recommended The principle should be described more correctly!!

author: 王贊富
text_en: Kushiya The more you connect in parallel, the greater the current, because your volts are fixed. The more you connect in parallel, the more you can withstand voltage, and the more you connect in series, the more current you can withstand. By the way, the more you connect in parallel, the smaller the resistance will be.

text: 俱矢耶 的確這個是伏打電池優～～不過串聯會增加電壓，就像是汽車的電池其實是好幾個電池組串連在一起，並聯的話可以讓電流比較穩定

text:
這是氧化還原反應 幫助高中同學複習 

氧化還原的活性大小 
氧化數由大到小依序如下:鋰銣鉀銫鋇鍶鈣 鈉鎂鋁錳鋅鉻鐵 鈷鎳錫鉛 氫銅汞銀鉑金

氧化數越大 越容易丟電子 是氧化反應 為還原劑
氧化數越小 越容易得到電子 是還原反應 為氧化劑

所以鋁相較銅易失去電子 銅易得到電子 而行成了電流所以手機才會有充電的狀態

能的話請鹽巴在解釋的清楚一點謝謝

這學測愛考 希望對你有幫助 
祝各位考生考試順利
author: 葉俊廷
text_en:
This is an oxidation-reduction reaction to help high school students review

Redox activity
The order of oxidation number from large to small is as follows: lithium rubidium potassium cesium barium strontium calcium sodium magnesium aluminum manganese zinc chromium iron cobalt nickel tin lead hydrogen copper mercury silver platinum

The larger the oxidation number, the easier it is to lose electrons. It is an oxidation reaction and a reducing agent.
The smaller the oxidation number, the easier it is to get electrons. It is a reduction reaction and an oxidant.

Therefore, aluminum is easier to lose electrons than copper, and copper is easier to get electrons and becomes a current, so the phone can be charged.

If you can, please explain it clearly. Thank you

I hope this test love test will help you
I wish you all the test takers success

影片中說銅跟鋁兩種金屬接觸時，金屬鋁會傾向把電子丟給金屬銅  我認為不太正確
金屬銅是相當安定的，化性活潑的是銅離子(Cu2+)
如果要做成鋁銅電池 (Al || Cu2+) 電解液中要有銅離子存在，然而片中只有金屬銅
就如片主上述所說，應該是金屬鋁和水中的氫離子之間存在電位差，進行氧化還原
鋁被氧化成鋁離子  氫離子被還原成氫氣
理論上來說  銅幣的陰極的角色換成碳棒或黃金來導電的效果(電壓)是一樣的   
只差在如果你用黃金看起來比較厲害   用起來比較爽
2Al + 6(H+) → 2 (Al3+) + 3 H2
因此是不會有樓上樓下一大票人說的毀損國幣的問題，銅幣根本不會反應掉

The film said that when copper and aluminum are in contact, metal aluminum tends to throw electrons to metal copper. I don’t think it’s correct.
Copper metal is quite stable, and the chemically active copper ion (Cu2+)
If you want to make an aluminum copper battery (Al || Cu2+), there must be copper ions in the electrolyte, but there is only metal copper in the film
As the film owner said above, there should be a potential difference between the metal aluminum and the hydrogen ions in the water for oxidation and reduction.
Aluminum is oxidized to aluminum ions, and hydrogen ions are reduced to hydrogen
Theoretically speaking, changing the role of the cathode of a copper coin to a carbon rod or gold to conduct electricity has the same effect (voltage).
The only difference is that if you use gold, it looks better.
2Al + 6(H+) → 2 (Al3+) + 3 H2
Therefore, there will not be the problem of damaging the national currency as mentioned by the people upstairs and downstairs, and the copper coins will not reflect

text:
大家好我是魯編
我來幫大家釐清一下大家用的專業術語
在這邊說「氧化數」其實是有爭議的
正確來說氧化數代表的是被氧化的程度
也就是失去電子的程度(被搶走多少顆電子)
所以氧化數高其實會更難失去電子
我想樓主想說的應該是「活性」吧？
活性代表物質丟電子的傾向，活性越大越傾向丟電子
但這種傾向不代表數量也與氧化數表現的傾向相反
所以希望大家不要把「活性」跟「氧化數」搞混了唷！
至於兩極所發生的反應
就是鋁失去電子(氧化反應)產生鋁離子
銅得到電子(還原反應)但由於銅金屬並不缺電子所以這些電子會交給溶液中的陽離子
這時溶液中的陽離子只有氫離子和鈉離子還有剛被氧化的鋁
鈉本身活性極高(非常想丟電子)所以變成鈉離子之後就會變得相當穩定
而被氧化的鋁(鋁離子)本身剛被氧化距離銅電極的距離不如原本就在溶液中的另外兩種陽離子
所以銅電極接受到電子後會將電子提供給氫離子
讓氫離子得到電子(還原反應)變成氫氣
所以說銅本身並不會在這裡發生還原而是讓氫離子被還原了唷！
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Hello everyone, I am Lubian
Let me help you clarify the terminology you use
It is actually controversial to say "oxidation number" here.
Correctly speaking, the oxidation number represents the degree of oxidation
That is, the degree of loss of electrons (how many electrons were robbed)
So it’s actually harder to lose electrons if the oxidation number is high
I think what the poster wants to say is "active", right?
Reactivity represents the tendency of a substance to lose electrons. The greater the activity, the more likely it is to lose electrons.
But this tendency does not mean the quantity is also opposite to the tendency of oxidation number performance.
So I hope you don’t confuse "activity" with "oxidation number"!
As for the reactions at the poles
That is, aluminum loses electrons (oxidation reaction) to produce aluminum ions
Copper gets electrons (reduction reaction), but since copper metal is not short of electrons, these electrons will be given to the cations in the solution
At this time, the only cations in the solution are hydrogen ions, sodium ions, and aluminum that has just been oxidized.
Sodium itself is extremely active (I want to lose electrons very much), so it becomes quite stable after becoming sodium ions
The distance between the oxidized aluminum (aluminum ion) itself and the copper electrode is not as good as the other two cations in the solution.
So the copper electrode will provide the electron to the hydrogen ion after receiving the electron
Let hydrogen ions get electrons (reduction reaction) into hydrogen
Therefore, the copper itself will not be reduced here, but the hydrogen ions will be reduced!

text:
俊廷葉 可以解釋一下氧化數的定義嗎？
好像跟我所學的不一樣
在我所學裡
金屬活性排序又稱作金屬氧化電位排序
氧化電位越大越容易氧化

反應過程中，若某元素的氧化數增加，則其進行氧化反應；反之，若某元素的氧化數減少，則其進行還原反應。
所以氧化數越大越容易還原當氧化劑
       氧化數越小越容易氧化當還原劑
此反應中
鋁相較於銅活性較大氧化電位較大
當還原劑 本身氧化做作陽極產生鋁離子
而在此實驗中氯化鈉也就是電解質只是幫助純水導電
而在陰極還原的既不是銅
也不是氯化鈉解離的氯離子或鈉離子
而是水本身還原產生氫氣
小弟學疏才淺
望大神指教
author: 黃俊翔
text_en:
Jun Tingye, can you explain the definition of oxidation number?
It seems different from what I learned
In what i learned
Metal activity sorting is also called metal oxidation potential sorting
The higher the oxidation potential, the easier it is to oxidize

During the reaction, if the oxidation number of an element increases, it will undergo an oxidation reaction; conversely, if the oxidation number of an element decreases, it will undergo a reduction reaction.
So the larger the oxidation number, the easier it is to reduce as an oxidant
       The smaller the oxidation number, the easier it is to oxidize as a reducing agent
In this reaction
Aluminum is more active than copper and has a higher oxidation potential
When the reducing agent itself oxidizes and acts as an anode to produce aluminum ions
In this experiment, sodium chloride, the electrolyte, only helps pure water conduct electricity
And it is not copper that is reduced at the cathode
Nor is it the chloride ion or sodium ion dissociated by sodium chloride
But the water itself is reduced to produce hydrogen
The younger brother is shallow in learning
Hope to teach

text:
首先，Na+ 在水中絕對不會還原的 
因為 Na+ 的還原電位 比水的還原電位低  在競爭還原半反應時  水會競爭成功  所以是水還原
另一個角度想  如果Na+真的還原了  會還原出金屬Na
金屬Na化性活潑   遇水又會劇烈反應 變回 Na+  並產生氫氣
所以結果還是氫氣被還原出來
如果Na+還原了  你很可能就會看到電池燒起來  甚至爆炸  很恐怖的
author: tber
text_en:
First of all, Na+ will never be reduced in water
Because the reduction potential of Na+ is lower than the reduction potential of water, water will compete successfully when competing for the reduction half-reaction, so it is water reduction.
From another point of view, if Na+ is really reduced, metal Na will be reduced.
Metal Na is active and reacts violently when it meets water, turning back to Na+ and producing hydrogen
So the result is that the hydrogen is reduced
If Na+ is restored, you will probably see the battery burn up or even explode. It’s terrifying.

text:
氧化和還原  必定同時發生同時結束
也就是  有人丟電子  就一定有人會接電子
金屬鋁丟了電子(氧化)  那就一定有人接那些電子
離子態的銅才可能會接電子(還原)  金屬銅已經是元素態 不會再接電子了  所以接電子的是其他人
現在列出有機會接電子(還原)的物質：
 Na+   或    Cl-      或 水
還原為氧化數下降      Cl- 的氧化數為-1，已經達到最低值  不能再還原
Na+在水中極為安定  亦不會還原
所以只剩水可以接電子還原
你可以視水為 H+  +  OH-   
OH-的O 氧化數為-2 已達最低值 不會還原
所以現在能還原的只剩H+  還原並產生氫氣 H2

這是應該是高中氧化還原還有化學電池會教到的課程
如果沒有接觸過的話  閱讀起來可能還是有點距離
看不太懂沒關係  這世界不需要每個人都念化學 
希望有幫到你
author: tber
text_en:
Oxidation and reduction must happen at the same time and end at the same time
That is, if someone loses an electron, someone will pick it up
Metal aluminum loses electrons (oxidation), then someone must pick up those electrons
The ionic copper may receive electrons (reduction). The metal copper is already in the element state and will no longer receive electrons. So it is someone else who receives the electrons.
Now list the substances that have the opportunity to receive electrons (reduction):
 Na+ or Cl- or water
Reduction to oxidation number decreased Cl- oxidation number is -1, which has reached the lowest value and can no longer be reduced
Na+ is extremely stable in water and will not be restored
So only water can be restored by electrons
You can think of water as H+ + OH-
The O oxidation number of OH- is -2 has reached the lowest value and will not be reduced
So now the only thing that can be reduced is H+ to reduce and produce hydrogen H2

This is a course that should be taught in high school redox and chemical batteries
If you haven’t touched it before, you may still be a bit distant
It’s okay if you don’t understand well, this world doesn’t need everyone to study chemistry
Hope it helps you

This experiment is good for entertainment and suitable for physical and chemical experiments in junior high schools. As for the practicality, it may only be used when it has to be a last resort, just like commercially available water batteries. It may not be useful in normal times, but it is easy to use when necessary

text: 我是理化老師，國中二年級的理化會提到，當時大多數人都支持道爾吞的原子說，大家都認為原子無法分割，不可能有離子，後來發現電子才能解釋離子的存在。另外阿瑞尼士因為被門得列夫批評過，後來門得列夫晚年差點得諾貝爾獎，聽說是被他搞掉的。
author: binladan911
text_en: I am a teacher of physics and chemistry. The Physics and Chemistry Association in the second grade of junior high school mentioned that at that time, most people supported Doltun’s atom theory. Everyone believed that atoms cannot be divided and there can be no ions. Later, it was discovered that electrons can explain the existence of ions. In addition, Arianis was criticized by Mendeleev. Later, Mendeleev almost won the Nobel Prize in his later years. It is said that he had killed him.

text:
你眼睛真利!!
沒錯~~這個道具論文是阿瑞尼士在得獎後做的研究
原本研究電解質的阿瑞尼士在研究後期轉向更多不同的領域
像這篇論文主要是在探討碳酸(二氧化碳)對大氣溫度的影響
至於為什會選這篇論文呢?
因為寫文本的魯富說他還沒找到阿瑞尼士電離說的原版論文
所以道具就先用阿瑞尼士其他的論文來作替代
魯富到現在都還在尋找這篇得獎的論文呢
不曉得大家有沒有人找到這篇論文願意跟魯富分享一下的呢?
魯富在電腦前面跪求大家了XD
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Your eyes are really sharp!!
That's right~~ This props thesis is a research done by Arenis after winning the award
Arianis, who originally studied electrolytes, turned to more different fields in the later stage of the research.
This paper like this is mainly about the influence of carbonic acid (carbon dioxide) on atmospheric temperature
As for why this paper was chosen?
Because Lu Fu, who wrote the text, said that he has not found the original paper on the ionization theory of Arenis.
So the props are first replaced by other papers by Arenis
Lu Fu is still looking for this award-winning paper
I wonder if anyone found this paper and would like to share it with Lu Fu?
Lu Fu begged everyone in front of the computer XD

text:
你們的團隊超棒的，今天剛發現就立刻訂閱了

願意分享知識而且不以營利為目的的人很少了

我拿到博士畢業之後也想當個youtuber提供生物科技方面的日常知識

從網站的資料庫上找會發現以中文做教學的資料真的很貧瘠

很多都是為了招募學生吸引收費的廣告網站

或者是利用偽科學使民眾混淆視聽，散播毫無根據的錯誤觀念

你們願意無私分享

真的是為教育圈注入了活水


後來我有一點小小建議

就是可以嘗試不同風格

例如說像很多網路紅人一樣以日常生活的發現去研究

然後和一群朋友打打鬧鬧並且進行實驗

這樣感覺比較不會拘謹而很自然

並且挖出一些假借科學來欺騙大眾的騙局並推翻

現在小孩的口味很奇怪又特別

像你們用到howhow的感覺很到位我就覺得很猛

我表弟就特別愛看別人的實況和喳科學之類的(雖然不是很正確的科學觀念)

卻連書都不肯碰  真希望透過你們的影片讓他激起學習興趣
author: 許玉米
text_en:
Your team is awesome, I immediately subscribed as soon as I found out today

Few people are willing to share knowledge and not for profit

After I graduated with my PhD, I also want to be a youtuber and provide daily knowledge of biotechnology.

Looking at the database on the website, you will find that the materials for teaching in Chinese are really poor

Many advertising sites are designed to recruit students to attract fees

Or use pseudoscience to confuse the public and spread baseless misconceptions

You are willing to share unselfishly

It really injects living water into the education circle


Later I have a little suggestion

You can try different styles

For example, like many Internet celebrities do research with daily discoveries

And then play around with a group of friends and experiment

It feels less restrained and natural

And dig out some scams that use science to deceive the public and overthrow them

Now children’s tastes are very strange and special

If you use howhow, the feeling is very good, I think it is very fierce

My cousin especially likes to watch other people’s facts and science (although not a very correct scientific concept)

But he wouldn’t even touch the book. I really hope that through your videos he arouses his interest in learning.

text: 可以燒/粉塵爆炸,因乒乓球用賽璐珞,缺點為其極易燃,容易發火的不耐久性,由於賽璐珞中含硝酸根，其硝基纖維素是製造火藥的基礎原料，所以它有一個很大的缺點，就是遇火、高熱極易燃燒。 較長時間的儲藏會讓賽璐珞逐漸發熱，若積熱不散就會引起自燃。
author: AC 0543
text_en: Can burn/dust explosion. Because celluloid used in table tennis, the disadvantage is that it is extremely flammable and easy to catch fire. It is not durable. Because celluloid contains nitrate, its nitrocellulose is the basic raw material for making gunpowder, so it has a very The big disadvantage is that it is easy to burn in case of fire and high heat. Long-term storage will cause celluloid to gradually heat up. If the accumulated heat does not dissipate, it will cause spontaneous combustion.

text:
石蕊其實是一種青苔~
波以耳那時候發現這種青苔的色素遇到酸鹼會變色，於是就把這種青苔研發成我們現在實驗室常常看到的石蕊試紙
有興趣可以google圖片石蕊
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Litmus is actually a kind of moss~
Boyle discovered that the pigment of this moss would change color when it encountered acid and alkali, so he developed this moss into litmus paper that we often see in the laboratory now.
If you are interested, you can google the picture litmus

text:
其實實驗中的雙氧水，在跟碘化鉀反應之後，就會變成水跟氧氣，而碘化鉀則是可以稀釋後排放，所以拿水沖一沖把肥皂泡沖掉就乾淨了喔!
有興趣可以查相關化學藥品的MSDS物質安全資料表
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
In fact, the hydrogen peroxide in the experiment, after reacting with potassium iodide, will become water and oxygen, and potassium iodide can be diluted and discharged, so flush the soap bubbles with water and it will be clean!
If you are interested, you can check the MSDS material safety data sheet of related chemicals

沒錯！燃素說同樣的解釋方法只在金屬上成立，其他物體卻沒有辦法，而且燃素派化學家想找的燃素到最後還是沒有真的被找到，而氧氣的發現正式把兩種狀況做了完整的解釋，不只如此氧氣還解釋了其他的現象，比起只能解釋燃燒還發生矛盾的燃素說，拉瓦節的氧化理論更接近真實的世界的觀察結果。
不過燃素說並沒有直接就消失了，而是又過了一段時間才慢慢地被科學淘汰掉。
author: LIS情境科學教材

That's right! Phlogiston said that the same explanation method is only valid on metals, but other objects have no way. Moreover, the phlogiston that phlogiston chemists were looking for was not actually found in the end, and the discovery of oxygen officially gave a complete explanation of the two conditions. Not only that, oxygen also explains other phenomena. Compared with phlogiston, which can only explain combustion and contradictions, the oxidation theory of Lava knot is closer to the observations of the real world.
However, Phlogiston said it did not disappear directly, but it took some time before it was slowly eliminated by science.

text:
十七世紀，被稱為是天才的世紀。當時除了被稱為天才的世紀以外，還有一件很重要的事情，便是歷史淵遠流長的鍊金術，就在此時開始走下坡，直到兩百年後＊1才正式離開世界舞台。我們都知道，波以耳靠著一本「懷疑的化學家」，打破了人們對於舊時代的迷思。但歷時千餘年的技術與邏輯，根深蒂固的思維又怎麼可能一夕之間扭轉呢？而今天要談的就是鍊金術到現代科學的過度產物——燃素說。

但要能夠真正明白鍊金術與現代科學，就得先拋棄一些後設的認知，從當代的角度去思考。第一件需要打破的事情，就是對於鍊金術神秘且怪裡怪氣的印象。鍊金術確實是神秘，但其神秘的原因是因為鍊金術如果放到現代的話，其實包含大量的神學、符號學、神秘學、心理學、醫學。如此複雜的系統在外人不瞭解的情況下，自然蒙上一層神秘色彩。但對於當代人來說，鍊金術並非迷信、妖言惑眾，而是一套流傳已久的系統。就跟我們現在認為地球科學、物理學一樣理所當然。換句話說，如果隨便問一個十七世紀的平民，鍊金術士跟醫生誰比較不能相信，搞不好大多數的人會挑穿著當代鳥嘴裝醫生。

當時的科學並不像現在，每一個學門都各自學海無涯，物理學家、化學家、生物學家都只能各自研究各自的領域；反而每一個科學家幾乎的都是多棲在各個領域裡。德國的約翰·約阿希姆·貝歇爾（後文稱貝歇爾）就同時身兼了醫生、探險家、經濟學家、鍊金術士及化學家＊2。在如此之多的領域中發展的他，曾經發表過語言書、動植礦物百科，也擔任過大主教的私人醫生和皇帝的經濟顧問，完全是指考一二三類組三冠王的進階版。不僅如此，他還發表過關於賢者之石真實性的演說。

同時貝歇爾主張，物質一般含有三種成分。分別是：存在於固體中，含量越多越硬的「石土」、流動性的物質就會含有的「汞土」、在可燃性物體中，控制燃燒能力的「油土」。這三種土，恰巧對應到了三元素說「鹽」、「汞」、「硫」的特性。物質中可能同時由兩種甚至是三種土所組成，而燃燒正是把油土與其他土分離的分解作用。

貝歇爾的燃燒理論有個仍有的鍊金術共通的老問題，就是用龐大的理論解釋單一的現象，而不適用在各種情形。例如無法解釋燃燒為何需要空氣、以及為何金屬燃燒分離出油土，反而重量增加＊3。而且僅停留在觀察並解釋現象，卻沒有實驗及數據的基礎來替理論背書。但這個理論，仍跨出了現代科學的第一步：就是將鍊金術中的神學、符號學等等學門抽離，只留下純然的化學。

同時這個理論，影響了貝歇爾的學生——格奧爾格·恩斯特·史塔爾（後文稱史塔爾）。承前文所述，當時的學門並沒有分得很明確，雖然史塔爾在貝歇爾身旁學習醫學，後來進入了醫學院，甚至成為御醫＊4。但史塔爾同時也承襲了貝歇爾的燃燒理論，將原本的油土改成燃素。燃素與油土不同之處，在於燃素是一種比空氣還輕的微粒。這些微粒十分活潑，是構成燃燒的根本，而我們所看到的火焰正是大量微粒聚集的結果＊5。

與貝歇爾不同的地方在於，燃素不再只能解釋單一的現象，而是幾乎能解釋所有燃燒時所發生的事。像是燃燒之所以需要空氣，是因為物體無法直接釋放燃素，而是需要有空氣來接收＊6。就像轉帳一樣，一定要有另一個人的帳戶來接收你的錢，否則錢是不能轉出的。至於金屬燃燒後為什麼會變重呢？因為剛剛提到燃素是比空氣還輕的微粒，燃素離開金屬後由空氣遞補原本的空隙，所以金屬自然而然就變重了。同時金屬生鏽變重，同樣也是因為燃素緩慢的離開金屬的原因。不僅是如此，金屬的冶煉也可以用木炭中的燃素轉移到了燃燒過的金屬渣，來解釋為什麼金屬渣會變回金屬的樣子。史塔爾甚至推測植物可以吸收燃素，而燃素便會通過食物鏈轉移到動物體內，最終燃素會在自然界中循環，這是為什麼不會有燃素用完而不能燃燒的一天＊7。

史塔爾的燃素理論，超越了他的老師貝歇爾。跨出了現代科學的第二步，也就是單一理論能解釋所有類似的狀況，而非單一現象。如此進步的方法與理論，使得當代對史塔爾的燃素說深信不疑，甚至有人稱當時為：燃素時期＊8。但這個理論其實存在一個致命的缺陷，就是當時缺少了定量且可重複的實驗。無法精準進行量測時，過大的實驗誤差容易使得燃素說缺乏精準的理論基礎。例如燃素比空氣輕使得金屬在燃燒後被空氣填滿空器變重，這說法在空隙更多的木柴燃燒中反而不適用＊9。

雖然後來燃素說被拉瓦節發現的氧化理論給推翻，終結了一段因為錯誤理論使得科學發展滯礙難行的時期＊10。但科學史中，燃素說卻不是一無是處，而是扮演著人們剛離開鍊金術，跌跌撞撞地走向現代科學的重要過程。同時也是一個借鏡，提醒著後世科學家，在科學上需要更為小心嚴謹。

＊1：在歐洲存在直至19世紀、牛頓鍊金手稿
＊2：維基百科＜貝歇爾＞（德文版有提到賢者之石）
＊3：維基百科＜史塔爾＞（史塔爾才有解釋這些）
＊4：同＊3生平的部分
＊5：燃燒本質的各種觀點
＊6：燃素並不能自動分解出來，必須藉空氣來吸收燃素
＊7：燃素雖然有重量，但是很輕----比空氣還輕（其餘的部分維基也有）
＊8：燃素時期
＊9：同＊7
＊10：脫燃素氣體
author: 陳胤達
text_en:
The seventeenth century was called the century of genius. At that time, apart from the century known as the genius, there was another very important thing. The alchemy with a long history began to decline at this time. It was not until two hundred years later*1 that it officially left the world stage. . We all know that Boyle broke people's myths about the old age by relying on a "skeptical chemist". But how can the technology, logic and deep-rooted thinking that have lasted for more than a thousand years be reversed overnight? What we are going to talk about today is the transitional product of alchemy to modern science-Phlogiston theory.

But to truly understand alchemy and modern science, you must first abandon some meta-cognitions and think from a contemporary perspective. The first thing that needs to be broken is the mysterious and weird impression of alchemy. Alchemy is indeed a mystery, but the reason for its mystery is that if it is put in modern times, it actually contains a lot of theology, semiotics, occult, psychology, and medicine. Such a complicated system naturally casts a layer of mystery when outsiders don't understand it. But for contemporary people, alchemy is not superstition or deceit, but a system that has been circulated for a long time. Just as we now take earth sciences and physics for granted. In other words, if you just ask a commoner in the seventeenth century, who is more unbelievable between an alchemist and a doctor, maybe most people will pick a doctor wearing a contemporary beak.

The science at that time was not like it is now. Every academic discipline has no boundaries. Physicists, chemists, and biologists can only study their own fields. On the contrary, almost every scientist lives in each field. In the field. John Joachim Becher (hereinafter referred to as Becher) of Germany was also a doctor, explorer, economist, alchemist, and chemist at the same time*2. He has developed in so many fields. He has published language books, animal and plant mineral encyclopedias, and also served as the archbishop’s personal doctor and the emperor’s economic adviser. He is completely referring to the advanced level of the triple crown in the first, second and third categories. Version. Not only that, he also delivered a speech on the authenticity of the sage's stone.

At the same time Becher argued that substances generally contain three components. They are: "rock soil" that exists in solids, the harder the content is, the "mercury soil" contained in fluid substances, and the "oil soil" that controls the burning ability of combustible objects. These three kinds of soil coincidentally correspond to the characteristics of the three elements "salt," "mercury," and "sulfur." The substance may be composed of two or even three kinds of soil at the same time, and burning is the decomposition effect of separating oily soil from other soils.

Becher's combustion theory has an old problem that is still common to alchemy, which is to explain a single phenomenon with a huge theory, which is not applicable to various situations. For example, it is impossible to explain why air is needed for combustion, and why metal burns to separate oil and soil, but the weight increases *3. Moreover, it only stays at observing and explaining phenomena, but there is no experimental and data basis to endorse the theory. But this theory still took the first step of modern science: it was to separate the theology, semiotics and so on in alchemy, leaving only pure chemistry.

At the same time, this theory influenced Becher's student-Georg Ernst Starr (hereinafter referred to as Starr). As mentioned in the previous article, there was no clear distinction between the academic disciplines at that time, although Stahl studied medicine next to Becher, later entered the medical school, and even became the imperial physician*4. But Starr also inherited Becher's combustion theory and changed the original oily soil to phlogiston. The difference between phlogiston and oily soil is that phlogiston is a kind of particles that are lighter than air. These particles are very lively and constitute the basis of combustion, and the flame we see is the result of a large number of particles gathering*5.

The difference from Becher is that phlogiston can no longer only explain a single phenomenon, but can explain almost everything that happens during combustion. For example, the reason why air is needed for combustion is because objects cannot directly release phlogiston, but need air to receive *6. Just like transferring money, you must have another person’s account to receive your money, otherwise the money cannot be transferred out. As for why the metal becomes heavier after burning? As mentioned earlier, phlogiston is a particle lighter than air. After the phlogiston leaves the metal, the air fills the original gap, so the metal naturally becomes heavier. At the same time, metal rusts and becomes heavier, also because the phlogiston slowly leaves the metal. Not only that, the smelting of metals can also use the phlogiston in the charcoal to transfer to the burned metal slag to explain why the metal slag turns back into a metal. Stahl even speculates that plants can absorb phlogiston, and phlogiston will be transferred to animals through the food chain, and eventually phlogiston will circulate in nature. This is why there is no day when phlogiston is used up and cannot be burned*7.

Stahl's phlogiston theory surpassed his teacher Becher. It has taken the second step of modern science, that is, a single theory can explain all similar situations, not a single phenomenon. Such advanced methods and theories have convinced the contemporary generation of Starr's phlogiston theory, and some even called it the phlogiston period*8. But this theory actually has a fatal flaw, that is, it lacked quantitative and repeatable experiments. When accurate measurement is not possible, too large experimental errors will easily make the phlogiston theory lack an accurate theoretical basis. For example, phlogiston is lighter than air, which makes the metal become heavier after being burned by air. This statement does not apply to the burning of wood with more voids*9.

Although the phlogiston theory was later overthrown by the oxidation theory discovered by Lava Jie, it ended a period when scientific development was hindered by the wrong theory*10. But in the history of science, the phlogiston theory is not useless, but plays an important process in which people have just left alchemy and stumbled towards modern science. At the same time, it is also a reference to remind future scientists that they need to be more careful and rigorous in science.

＊1: Existed in Europe until the 19th century, Newtonian alchemy manuscripts
＊2: Wikipedia <Becher> (The Sage’s Stone is mentioned in the German version)
＊3: Wikipedia <Stal> (Stal only explains these)
＊4: The same as the part of the life of ＊3
*5: Various viewpoints on the nature of combustion
＊6: Phlogiston cannot be decomposed automatically, and air must be used to absorb phlogiston
＊7: Phlogiston has weight, but it is very light-lighter than air (the rest of the wiki also has it)
＊8: Phlogiston period
*9: Same as *7
＊10: Dephlogiston gas

text:
概念上可行，但在實際實驗中，把中子打入汞196操作上可行，但從汞198的原子核中把中子取出(原子核的大小小於10的負14次方)技術上做不到。
而汞在自然界中的同位素有196、198、299、200、201、202、204，196是自然界最輕的汞。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
It is conceptually feasible, but in actual experiments, it is operationally feasible to inject neutrons into mercury 196, but it is technically impossible to remove neutrons from the nucleus of mercury 198 (the size of the nucleus is less than 10 to the minus 14 power).
The isotopes of mercury in nature are 196, 198, 299, 200, 201, 202, 204, and 196 is the lightest mercury in nature.

text_en: High cost

text: 不太一樣唷！核融合是將兩顆輕的原子核對撞後，形成一顆較重的原子，並在過程中放出能量。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: It's not the same! Nuclear fusion involves colliding two light nuclei to form a heavier atom and release energy in the process.

text:
不錯有做過功課，汞197會自然衰變成金197，對中間過程有興趣可以參考「電子捕獲」的維基條目。

不過汞197既然會自然衰變成金197，那自然界怎麼還會存在汞197呢? 通通都變成金了才對吧?

穩定存在於自然界的汞元素有七種，分別為汞196、汞198、汞199、汞200、汞201、汞202、汞204，並沒有汞197。

而要做出汞197，最簡單的方法(一點都不簡單)就是把自然界存在的汞198打入γ射線，把一顆中子打出來，然後等汞197他衰變成金197。

至於要打入多強的γ射線我不知道，但理論上是可行的。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Yes, I have done my homework. Mercury 197 will naturally decay into gold 197. If you are interested in the intermediate process, please refer to the Wiki entry on "Electronic Capture".

But since mercury 197 will naturally decay into gold 197, why does mercury 197 still exist in nature? All things become gold, right?

There are seven kinds of mercury elements stably existing in nature, namely mercury 196, mercury 198, mercury 199, mercury 200, mercury 201, mercury 202, and mercury 204. There is no mercury 197.

To make mercury 197, the easiest way (not simple at all) is to inject the mercury 198 that exists in nature into gamma rays, shoot out a neutron, and wait for the mercury 197 to decay into gold 197.

As for the intensity of gamma rays to be injected, I don't know, but it is theoretically feasible.

LIS Science Channel
Regarding the fluorescent lamp, you should say this in more detail:
The free electric field generated by the high voltage in the center of the plasma ball excites the mercury atoms in the fluorescent tube, causing the electron energy level to transition, and the generated ultraviolet light is absorbed by the fluorescent material and then emits visible light XD

author: 賴柏
text_en: @LISContext Science Textbook I like this explanation~

text:
主要差別在於「粒子有碰撞，波動有干涉」
在解釋碰撞與干涉是什麼之前，先讓我說個故事：

假裝我們是正在決鬥的西部牛仔
我們拔槍決鬥，場面異常火爆
我為了躲避子彈躲到了掩體後面
你一邊開槍一邊要求我投降
我聽到你開槍的巨大聲響
還有你微弱的聲音

故事不怎麼樣我知道
不過呢，當我覺得躲到掩體後面能擋子彈的時候
就說明了我認為子彈是具有粒子特性的
會因為撞到掩體而被抵銷，也就是碰撞

我躲到掩體後面，你仍然對我叫囂
這表示你知道聲音不會被掩體阻擋
聲音應該不具有粒子特性。

而後，你一邊開槍一邊叫囂
我聽到了巨大槍聲還有微小叫囂聲
兩個聲音都傳到了我的耳朵
聽起來像是兩個聲音加起來的狀況
這就是干涉，兩個聲音可以疊在一起
但兩顆子彈應該是沒辦法疊在一起
他們會碰撞並產生反射或是擊碎之類的現象

有興趣波與粒子到底發生什麼事情，可以看看物理線光學虎克的逆襲與牛頓的反擊。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
The main difference is that "particles collide, and waves interfere."
Before explaining what collision and interference are, let me tell a story:

Pretend we are western cowboys in a duel
We drew our guns for a duel, the scene was extremely hot
I hid behind the bunker to avoid the bullet
You shoot and ask me to surrender
I heard the loud sound of your shooting
And your faint voice

I know the story is not good
However, when I think hiding behind a bunker can block bullets
It shows that I think bullets have particle characteristics
Will be offset by hitting the bunker, which is a collision

I hid behind the bunker, you still yell at me
This means you know that the sound will not be blocked by the cover
The sound should not have particle properties.

Then, you shot and shouted
I heard huge gunfire and small clamor
Both voices reached my ears
It sounds like a combination of two voices
This is interference, two sounds can be stacked together
But two bullets should not be able to stack together
They will collide and cause reflections or crushing phenomena

If you are interested in what happens to waves and particles, you can look at the counterattack of the physical line optics Hooke and Newton's counterattack.

text: LIS-科學氮磷氧 原來如此！真不簡單呀！多謝指教！
author: Fiona
text_en: LIS-Science Nitrogen, Phosphorus and Oxygen It's not easy! Thanks for your advice!

text: 隱形人 雙氧水基本上就是用來抵銷維他命c的效果，但一般藥局的雙氧水濃度很低，可是維他命c濃度很高，雙氧水自然敵不過大量的維他命c，也因此我們會把維他命c稀釋。剛剛好讓紙上顏色不見即可，這樣才不會有過多的維他命在紙上
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: Invisible Man Hydrogen peroxide is basically used to offset the effect of vitamin C. However, the concentration of hydrogen peroxide in general pharmacies is very low, but the concentration of vitamin C is very high. Hydrogen peroxide is naturally no match for a large amount of vitamin C, so we will dilute vitamin C. Just make the color disappear on the paper so that there won’t be too many vitamins on the paper

text: LIS-科學氮磷氧 謝謝指教！稀釋了碘，另外轉用了維他命C碇後，效果出來了！但又遇到了難題，就是再塗上了雙氧水後，卻沒有再顯形呢？希望可以再分享竅門！
author: Fiona
text_en: LIS-Science Nitrogen, Phosphorus and Oxygen Thank you for your advice! After diluting the iodine and switching to vitamin C, the effect came out! But I ran into a problem again, that is, after applying hydrogen peroxide, it didn't show up again? Hope to share more tips!

text:
讓優碘變透明主要是靠維他命C
我們之前有出現跟妳一樣的狀況
第一種是把優碘稀釋，因為檸檬的維他命C含量有限，直接用純的優碘會因為碘太多，檸檬的維他命C不夠讓所有的碘消失，所以弄稀一點讓碘少一點。
第二種是用維他命C錠，這種的維他命C超多，塗一下等個幾十秒就有效果了
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Vitamin C makes betadine transparent
We had the same situation as you before
The first is to dilute betadine, because lemons have a limited vitamin C content. Directly using pure betadine will cause too much iodine and lemon vitamin C is not enough to make all the iodine disappear, so make it thinner to make the iodine less.
The second is to use vitamin C ingots. This kind of vitamin C is super-rich, and it will be effective after a few tens of seconds after applying it.

text: 乾冰的溫度是零下78度、金屬約25度，當金屬湯匙接觸到乾冰時，由於兩者溫度相差約100度，造成乾冰與湯匙的接觸面產生了大量的二氧化碳，湯匙因而被推開乾冰表面。湯匙離開乾冰表面後，因為重量掉下來，又和乾冰接觸，再次產生二氧化碳被推開，如此反覆，就產生了振動而發出聲音。
author: 陳宥芯
text_en: The temperature of dry ice is minus 78 degrees and metal is about 25 degrees. When the metal spoon comes into contact with dry ice, the difference between the two temperatures is about 100 degrees, causing a large amount of carbon dioxide to be produced on the contact surface of the dry ice and the spoon, and the spoon is pushed away from the surface of the dry ice . After the spoon leaves the surface of the dry ice, it drops due to its weight and comes into contact with the dry ice again. Carbon dioxide is generated again and pushed away. Repeatedly, vibration and sound are generated.

text:
圓是描述原子的一種簡化方式。
其實原子不是圓的，電子雲的形狀很豐富，特别是在分子成鍵後，電子雲可以走8字形、四面體形..等等。
這些電子雲的分佈機率可以用量子力學計算出來。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Circles are a simplified way of describing atoms.
In fact, the atom is not round, and the electron cloud is very rich in shape, especially after the molecules are bonded, the electron cloud can take the shape of a figure of eight, a tetrahedron... and so on.
The distribution probability of these electron clouds can be calculated by quantum mechanics.

text: 我想問一下 你們是不是有把水降溫 因為我做過後發現效果不是很顯著 想說把水溫降很低 結果就成功了
author: yu xiang Huang
text_en: I want to ask if you have cooled the water because after I did it, I found that the effect is not very significant. I want to say that the water temperature is lowered and the result is successful.

text: 不要拿玻璃直接用火烤，如果單純用微波爐加熱水，玻璃瓶最多100度，放到冷水中還不會熱漲冷縮破掉，可是如果用火烤，玻璃就會超過100度，放到冷水中，急遽的溫度變化很容易熱漲冷縮破裂。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: Do not use the glass to bake it directly. If you simply use a microwave to heat the water, the glass bottle will be up to 100 degrees, and it will not heat up and shrink when placed in cold water. In cold water, sudden temperature changes can easily break due to thermal expansion and contraction.

text: 其實不一定要把水降溫，不過水的溫度越低瓶子裡的空氣液化的效果越好，瓶子越接近真空自然吸水的效果會比較好囉~
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: In fact, it is not necessary to cool the water, but the lower the temperature of the water, the better the effect of air liquefaction in the bottle. The closer the bottle is to the vacuum, the better the effect of natural water absorption.

text: 焰色是物質內的電子獲得能量躍遷再回到基態釋放能量後發光，過程中不涉及分子重新排列，焰色應為物理變化；但焰色反應會伴隨氧化還原，分子重新排列形成氧化物，因此整個過程應為化學變化。
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: The flame color is that the electrons in the substance gain energy and then return to the ground state to release energy and then emit light. The process does not involve molecular rearrangement. The flame color should be a physical change; but the flame color reaction will be accompanied by redox, and the molecules rearrange to form oxides. Therefore, the whole process should be a chemical change.

text:
謝謝你的建議~
不過我們在煉金術這集中主要是探討以科學的方式來探索世界
並沒有要貶低宗教的意思
對於神這樣的腳色並沒有對錯的問題
以科學的角度我們也不能說神一定不存在
但我們在這些內容中比較著重在破除迷信、理性思考的方式來面對真實的世界
這之中並沒有否定宗教的意涵
而是單純以過去比較特殊的儀式去探討
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Thank you for your suggestion~
But in this episode of alchemy, we mainly discuss exploring the world in a scientific way
Does not mean to belittle religion
There is no question of right or wrong for a role like God
From a scientific point of view, we cannot say that God definitely does not exist
But in these contents, we are more focused on breaking the superstition and facing the real world in a rational way of thinking.
There is no denial of religion
But simply discuss it with the special rituals of the past

text:
如果容器不乾淨，還有殘留粉末或是灰塵，受到撞擊才會開始結晶；相反的，如果容器有保持乾淨，是可以承受一定的撞擊，但還是盡量小心移動並且減少震動，如果擔心有意外的話，建議當場製作比較沒有這種問題。

降溫就需要看你的目的是什麼，劇烈溫度變化的確有可能影響結晶，如果時間足夠，建議靜置冷卻，而你可以都嘗試看看!
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
If the container is not clean and there is residual powder or dust, it will start to crystallize after impact; on the contrary, if the container is kept clean, it can withstand a certain impact, but try to move it carefully and reduce vibration, if you are worried about accidents , It is recommended that there is no such problem when making on the spot.

Cooling down depends on what your purpose is. Severe temperature changes may indeed affect the crystallization. If there is enough time, it is recommended to stand for cooling, and you can try them all!

text:
柔蜜你好～
醋酸鈉可以在一般的化工行買到喔，若附近沒有化工行，也可以網路購買。
配製成過飽合溶液的方式影片中有說明
基本上是不要吃，不要碰眼睛（戴護目鏡），戴手套操作
祝你實驗成功XD


[醋酸鈉]使用注意事項：
刺激眼睛、皮膚、呼吸系統、切勿吞食
配戴護目鏡、口罩、手套、置於陰涼且通風良好處、弱鹼性
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Hello, Roumi~
Sodium acetate can be bought at a general chemical shop. If there is no chemical shop nearby, you can also buy it online.
The way to prepare a supersaturated solution is explained in the video
Basically don’t eat, don’t touch your eyes (wear goggles), and operate with gloves
I wish you a successful experiment XD


[Sodium acetate] Precautions for use:
Irritating to eyes, skin, respiratory system, do not swallow
Wear goggles, masks, gloves, keep in a cool and well-ventilated place, weakly alkaline

text: 我第一次做實驗是用水：醋酸鈉約為100：125＊3,加熱到60度就全部溶解，想用冷水降溫時，顆粒就出現了，後來是成塊的結晶出現，後來又用你們的比例1:3再做一次，但這次是降溫至室溫後就沒變化了，請問：是原料的問題嗎？為何做不出你們用手一摸就會結晶的效果呢？？
author: 慧君姚
text_en: The first experiment I did was with water: Sodium acetate is about 100:125*3, and it will be dissolved when heated to 60 degrees. When I want to use cold water to cool down, the particles will appear, and then agglomerated crystals will appear, and then you will be used again. Do it again with a ratio of 1:3, but this time it has not changed after cooling to room temperature. May I ask: Is it the raw material? Why can't you achieve the effect that you will crystallize with the touch of your hand? ?

text_en: The change from a solid state to a liquid state is heat absorption (mostly), and the opposite is true when the foot is stepped on, and the liquid state turns into a solid state and releases heat.

text:
對喔，析出和溶解是相反的過程。醋酸鈉溶掉不見時會冰冰的(吸收外界的熱)，所以醋酸鈉跑出來的時候就會把吸收的熱放出來，所以會感覺很熱。

你真厲害~~
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Yes, precipitation and dissolution are opposite processes. Sodium acetate will freeze when it dissolves (absorb external heat), so when sodium acetate runs out, it will release the absorbed heat, so it will feel very hot.

You are amazing~~

text:
1.建議可以再繼續加溫一下，確保醋酸鈉都溶解。
2.溶解後務必到進另一個乾淨的容器，確保容器邊緣沒有任何醋酸鈉的固體，因為有些是肉眼看不到，但實際上有，所以換新的比較保險。
3.如果顆粒依然出現，建議加蓋(避免空氣中的東西掉入造成結晶)再靜置放涼。
我們之前用冷水加速降溫，失敗機率較高，這個實驗完全急不得~~~

水1醋酸鈉3這個比例，我們自己做可以做得出來XDDD
原料我們之前試過全白跟帶黃色的醋酸鈉，淡黃色的做不出來，要純白的醋酸鈉
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
1. It is recommended to continue heating to ensure that the sodium acetate is dissolved.
2. After dissolving, be sure to put into another clean container, make sure that there is no sodium acetate solid on the edge of the container, because some are invisible to the naked eye, but in fact, it is safer to replace it with a new one.
3. If the particles still appear, it is recommended to cover it (to prevent crystallization from falling into the air) and then let it stand to cool.
We used cold water to speed up the temperature before, and the probability of failure was high. This experiment is completely in rush~~~

Water 1 sodium acetate 3 ratio, we can do it ourselves XDDD
For the raw materials, we have tried all white and yellow sodium acetate, but light yellow ones can’t be made. We need pure white sodium acetate.

text:
【學習為什麼要這麼有效率？】
創辦人嚴天浩在未來大人物上的短講影片出爐囉！
一直都沒機會聽到天浩本人分享創辦理念的朋友，小編無敵推薦大家花20分鐘一起來看此次的短講，他用了十分有趣生動的比喻，描述了台灣教育出現的問題。
短講中，天浩提到：「為什麼我們的學習要如此充滿效率？」我們將我們認為學生該學的知識抽出，切斷它們與生活的連結後再放入課本中，本以為是去蕪存菁的美意，卻也間接斬斷了學生學習的意願。
短講結束後，有高中生跑來和天浩合照，表示聽了他的短講覺得收穫很多。小編在一旁除了受寵若驚外，還有滿滿的感動。
記得小時候，我們總喜歡爬到父母的肩膀上，想看得更遠、更接近大人的高度，從小我們就有著好奇與探索的能力。教育從來就不只是上對下的傳遞，現在，我們想把學習的空間還給孩子，讓他們用對的方式慢慢學！
--------------------------------------------------------
【大愛覺醒年代專訪】http://goo.gl/CgOuJm 
【LIS網站】http://www.learningissharing.com/
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
【Why is learning so efficient? 】
The short video of the founder Yan Tianhao on the big figures of the future is out!
Friends who have never had the opportunity to hear Tianhao's own founding philosophy, Xiaobian Wudi recommends everyone to take 20 minutes to watch this short talk together. He used a very interesting and vivid metaphor to describe the problems in Taiwan's education.
In the short talk, Tian Hao mentioned: "Why should our learning be so efficient?" We extracted the knowledge that we think students should learn, cut off the connection between them and life, and then put it into the textbook. We thought it was rid of it. Cun Jing's good intentions also indirectly cut off the students' willingness to learn.
After the short talk, a high school student came to take a photo with Tian Hao, saying that after listening to his short talk, he felt that he had gained a lot. In addition to being flattered, the editor is also full of touch.
I remember that when we were young, we always liked to climb on the shoulders of our parents. We wanted to see farther and closer to the height of adults. Since we were young, we have the ability to be curious and explore. Education has never been just a transfer from top to bottom. Now, we want to return the learning space to children so that they can learn slowly in the right way!
-------------------------------------------------- ------
[Interview with the Age of Great Love Awakening] http://goo.gl/CgOuJm
[LIS website] http://www.learningissharing.com/

text: 分解者有什麼重要性
author: Lin Eunice
text_en: What is the importance of decomposers

text:
細菌負責分解💩 屬於分解者
細菌不是吃硫 只是分解硫而已
因為💩含有養分 細菌吃它可以獲得養分
正好符合:
分解屍體得到養分 的條件
所以細菌屬於分解者
不過說他是消費者也不為過
因為💩因為也可以算是有機物
正好符合: ...吃其他的有機物(動、植物..)來存活
的條件
如果聽不懂也可以自己去google如果我的解說有誤 可以告訴我
如果正確無誤的話 給個👍應該不過分吧?
author: 陳胤達
text_en:
Bacteria are responsible for decomposition 💩 belong to the decomposer
Bacteria don’t eat sulphur, they just decompose sulphur.
Because 💩 contains nutrients, bacteria can eat it to get nutrients
Exactly meet:
Conditions for decomposing corpses to obtain nutrients
So bacteria are decomposers
But it’s not an exaggeration to say that he is a consumer
Because 💩Because it can also be regarded as organic
It just fits: ...eat other organic matter (animals, plants...) to survive
conditions of
If you don’t understand, you can go to Google by yourself. If my explanation is wrong, you can tell me.
If it's correct, it shouldn't be too much, right?

text: +LIS 我知道了  謝謝你😊
author: Cathy Green
text_en: +LIS I got it, thank you 😊

text:
+夏沁 
這個問題由小編為你解答

消費者(異營生物):無法將大自然中的陽光或無機物合成自身所需養分，必須靠著吃其他的有機物(動、植物..)來存活

生產者(自營生物):可以利用陽光、空氣中的二氧化碳、水以及無機物等，轉換成自己所需的養分。

吃硫的細菌，因為他是吃硫化物(無機鹽)維生，不是吃其他動植物或有機物，所以不會歸類為消費者喔

維基百科連結:https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%87%AA%E5%85%BB%E7%94%9F%E7%89%A9
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
+Xia Qin
Xiaobian will answer this question for you

Consumers (foreign organisms): unable to synthesize the nutrients needed by the sun or inorganic substances in nature, and must rely on eating other organic substances (animals, plants...) to survive

Producer (self-supporting organisms): can use sunlight, carbon dioxide in the air, water and inorganic substances to convert them into nutrients they need.

Sulfur-eating bacteria are not classified as consumers because they eat sulfide (inorganic salt) instead of other animals, plants or organic matter.

Wikipedia link: https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%87%AA%E5%85%BB%E7%94%9F%E7%89%A9

text: 在錄製的時候疏忽未注意到，已加上註解修正
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: I didn’t notice it when recording, and it has been commented and corrected.

text:
水可以通過水通道蛋白通過細胞膜!
在這部影片中由於我們是依照課本的內容去製作，課本內容並未深入提到水通過細胞膜的管道，所以只先讓觀眾了解水通過細胞膜的滲透概念，就未再深入講述其他的通道蛋白。
謝謝您的建議
附上:水通道蛋白介紹文章http://highscope.ch.ntu.edu.tw/wordpress/?p=964
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Water can pass through the cell membrane through aquaporin!
In this video, since we made it according to the content of the textbook, the textbook content did not mention the passage of water through the cell membrane in depth, so we only let the audience understand the concept of water penetration through the cell membrane, and did not discuss other channel proteins in depth. .
Thank you for your suggestion
Attach: Introduction to Aquaporin http://highscope.ch.ntu.edu.tw/wordpress/?p=964

text: +Josephine Wong 以台灣國中(初中)的生物內容來說，主要讓學生知道物質進出細胞膜有主被動運輸的分別，但主動運輸詳細項目或是內容，到更高年級才會談到。而這部主要設計給國中生看，所以就沒有再做更詳細的介紹，不然學生也會腦袋一團亂
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: +Josephine Wong takes the biological content of Taiwan Junior High School (junior high school) as an example, mainly to let students know that there are active and passive transportation of substances in and out of the cell membrane, but the detailed items or content of active transportation will not be discussed until higher grades. This is mainly designed for junior high school students, so I didn’t give a more detailed introduction, otherwise the students would be confused.

text: 不懂！
author: 葉磊
text_en: Don't understand!

text:
請問你是問第幾秒的地方呢?
如果是1:17要去判斷月亮亮哪邊的話，記得要讓那個月亮是朝上的，例如說下弦月因為圖片上該月亮在下面，所以要把螢幕轉180度讓他在上面，去判斷他是右邊亮還是左邊亮。其他的月相依此類推，要選轉螢幕讓月亮朝上再去判斷喔
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
Excuse me, how many seconds do you ask?
If it is 1:17 to judge which side of the moon is bright, remember to make the moon face up. For example, the last quarter moon is because the moon is below in the picture, so turn the screen 180 degrees so that he is on top to judge. Is he bright on the right or on the left? The other moon phases and so on, you have to choose to turn the screen so that the moon is up to judge.

text: +LIS 有!懂了，謝謝 😃
author: 婷康
text_en: +LIS Yes! Got it, thank you 😃

text: +婷康 如果在台灣看月亮的時候，你往南方看，會看到天空中的月亮軌跡類似這張圖的拋物線http://p1.pstatp.com/large/8168/3084896736，月亮從東邊升起西邊落下。所以在西方地平線看到月亮的時候，會是這個月亮要落下的時候，而落下的曲線如果跟我貼的那張圖對照的話，你能看的出來為甚麼會是往右下嗎?
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: +Tingkang If you look to the south when looking at the moon in Taiwan, you will see the moon's path in the sky resembling the parabola in this picture http://p1.pstatp.com/large/8168/3084896736, the moon rises from the east From the west to fall. So when you see the moon on the western horizon, it will be when the moon is about to set, and if the curve of the fall is compared with the picture I posted, can you see why it goes down to the right?

新年新一波的影片出來囉！
這次天浩老師要為大家講解的是102年學測第12題
生物科的基因轉殖部分

節省學習的時間

我們是LIS
我們希望台灣的教育，因為我們能有一點點的不一樣
#高中 #線上教學課程
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
A new wave of videos for the new year comes out!
This time Mr. Tianhao is going to explain to everyone the 12th question of the 102 year test.
The gene transfer part of the biology department
Pictures are used in the film to help students convert text into images
Attracted by pictures, and then willing to listen, to facilitate understanding and memory
After the film is over, a concept related to this topic is set up
Help students who study at home can find what they need right away
Save time for study

We are LIS
We want education in Taiwan because we can be a little bit different
#高中 #Online teaching courses

text:
【部部影片通頭腦】
哈囉~大家好
眾所期待的影片又來了！
小編認真的看完102年學測第50題化學
小編的化學沒有很好，以前都看不太懂
當看完帥氣荏富老師的講解後，完全恍然大悟阿！
其實就是兩個重要的概念哦
1.金屬活性(也就是還原能力)
2.沉澱表
有了這兩個大方向，寫這一題根本是輕而易舉阿！
大家可以跟小編一樣先看看題目，心中想好答案
再來看看是不是跟自己想的一樣！
荏富老師還有貼心地幫我們想一個有趣的口訣
真的對記憶非常有幫助阿！
趕快點進去看看 GO！
#學測 #化學 #線上課程

[LIS]學測懂了沒!-102年第50題(化學)
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en:
[All movies are through the mind]
Hello~ everyone
The much-anticipated movie is here again!
The editor carefully read the 50th question of chemistry in the 102 year test
The chemistry of the editor is not very good, I didn’t understand it before
After reading the explanation given by the handsome teacher Eunfu, I suddenly realized it!
In fact, they are two important concepts
1. Metal activity (that is, reducing power)
2. Precipitation table
With these two general directions, writing this question is simply a breeze!
You can look at the question first like the editor and think of the answer in your mind
Let's see if it is the same as you thought!
Teacher Lin Fu also thoughtfully helped us think of an interesting formula
It's really helpful for memory!
Hurry up and go in and have a look at GO!
#学测 #chemistry #online course

[LIS] Did you understand the test?-Question 50 (Chemistry) in 102

text: 許伯睿 森77不好
author: LIS情境科學教材
text_en: Xu Borui, Sen 77 is not good

text:
第3項也有錯!!
1,原子由電子、質子、中子構成，故原子並非最小粒子
2.同位素化性相同但質量可不同。同量數化性不同但質量可相同
3.有部分超導體或部分晶格有缺陷，使原子間長不以整數比例存在 ex:NiO(絕緣體)&Ni0.97O(半導體)->又稱作非計量化合物
   (原子當然不會被切一半，但是原子不會被切一半和是否為整數比根本是兩回事->詳見平均分子量、平均化學式)
4.核反應時，原子的種類和數目均會改變
所以原子說4項皆須修正
author: Book11的世界
text_en:
Item 3 is also wrong!!
1. Atoms are composed of electrons, protons and neutrons, so atoms are not the smallest particles
2. The isotopic properties are the same but the quality can be different. Same quantity, different digitization but same quality
3. Part of the superconductor or part of the crystal lattice is defective, so that the interatomic length does not exist in an integer ratio. ex: NiO (insulator) & Ni0.97O (semiconductor) -> also known as non-quantitative compounds
   (Of course the atom will not be cut in half, but the atom will not be cut in half and whether it is an integer ratio is basically two different things -> see average molecular weight and average chemical formula for details)
4. During a nuclear reaction, the type and number of atoms will change
So Atom says all 4 items must be revised
